description:
My wife and I came here for lunch on a Saturday and we were extremely pleased with our experience.  The food was fresh and delicious; I had the beef teriyaki and she had a sushi sampler.

The service was polite and attentive and the value we got for our meal was very good.

Overall, I give this tried-and-true Japantown restaurant an enthusiastic thumbs-up.  We'll be back!.
author: Emily B.

description:
Ramen - too salty, flavorless otherwise 
Yakitori - pretty good 

The worst is what they gave me as "mochi ice cream" - stale waffle wrapped around ice cream, no mochi in sight
author: dogdaysOsummer A.

description:
Dishonest business practices. 

Watch out that the tip is always included. However, it is misleading that the final receipt comes with tip check boxes. However be warned there is an automatic tip already added. Figured this out way too late -- that we gave essentially a 36% tip for mediocre tip and service. Fail.
author: J P.

description: Came in on Sunday afternoon for an appetizer and a couple of sushi rolls.  Ordered the tempura appetizer and some sushi.  The waitress brought out a bowl of miso soup, a salad and a bowl of rice.  We ate the soup and salad. Then she delivered and announced the tempura "lunch".  I told her that I had asked for the tempura appetizer, not the lunch.  But I was told that I had already eaten the soup and salad that I must pay for the entree.  Really?  Whatever.  The sushi wasn't all that great, avocado was old and brown.  I would not recommend this place.
author: Joe T.

description: My dish was okay at this place! I got the sukiyaki don which I don't recommend. It lacks flavor. The Giants roll (I think that's what it's called) is pretty good. It had spicy tuna and crab on top. This was crunchy and delicious! The service was okay and quick. The restaurant wasn't too full. The other dishes looked good but I was a little disappointed w my beef and tofu dish. I don't know if the sauce was omitted but it tasted like boiled meat with cooked veggies and a splash of soy sauce. The meat was a bit off. I did have some teriyaki chicken and that was good. I would probably get chicken next time!
author: Natalie M.

description:
Came here for a quick lunch with my dad. I never like eating sushi in Japantown because it's almost all low quality over priced tourist traps but we were visiting my grandmother across the street. We were going to go inside Japantown but he wanted to watch his parking meter so we went to this place right across from it. 

It was exactly as expected. I am not sure why all these negative reviews are talking about inauthentic Japanese food like hello what else do you expect from a place like this? I got the two item lunch bento and ordered my dad the tempura and soup noodle combo. As average as can be, we didn't even take our leftovers. Their bento does have extra pickled veggies I don't usually see which is a nice touch. Salmon teriyaki is salty and over cooked. 

Service was fine, no one was rude like the other comments suggested. It was very empty at lunch time on a Friday.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Happened to stop by this place while I was shopping with a friend at Daiso across the street. It's an older restaurant on the inside and based on Yelp reviews, I was surprised that the food was actually pretty good!

We started with the tempura appetizer which was fresh and crispy and plentiful with veggies and shrimp. The spinach gomae was spot on. The lion king roll was also great. 

The two ladies that served us were sweet and very attentive.
author: Elaine Tiffany P.

description: Overpriced mediocre (at best) food. Ordered veggie sukiyaki over brown rice last night. It was just about flavorless and the tofu was raw. Service was extremely nice though. And in fairness, I haven't tried anything else. But I won't be, after wasting my $15 or so on this lack of effort and respect.
author: Ben R.

description:
Food was cool.. Service wasn't

Came in at around 3pm for a late lunch. 

Food

Ordered the 3 Item Combo Bento Box with Grilled Salmon Roll, Teriyaki Saba, and the Teriyaki Salmon. It came with a Miso Soup and Side Salad for $13.50

   Miso Soup
This dish arrived hot and the broth tasted yummy.  The downside was our server never came by to give me a spoon. 

 Beer

Small Sapporro 3.50. 
 Standard issue bottled Sapporro. Seemed to pair well with my bento box. 

Atmosphere and Service

Unfortunately the moment my guest and I sat down we immediately noticed how sticky the table was. For me whenever I encounter a table like this it's very off putting and somewhat detracts from my appetite 

Our server wasn't very friendly or customer service oriented. She only came back to check on us when our meal was finished and halfway through my meal I had to remind her that she had yet to bring me the beer I ordered earlier. 

Overall I had a medicore time here. I recommend looking elsewhere for your next dining experience.
author: Nicholas B.

description: Delicious sushi! Honestly the best sushi I've had in SF. We ordered California tempura and dinamite!! Soooo good and fresh. Nice staff and good atmosphere. Will definitely be coming back for more.
author: Isabel P.

description:
I've been eating here the entirety of my life. Or more literally like since Day 138 or something. Thus it's a family favorite. I love seeing Sunny and Susan, two principals there. The seating is wonderful and homey, so many good memories and a welcome break from the more touristy spots in the mall. 

I look forward to the reality show that challenges you to eat things if the Sanppo special sauce is put all over it. Deep fried tarantulas covered in Sanppo special sauce works well for me.

I also like how the translation of Sanppo in Japanese is "To Stroll".
author: Adam G.

description: Was pleasantly surprised by the delicious sushi & super fresh piping hot tempura. I enjoyed this restaurant very much. I had the island roll & it had lovely bits of thinly lemon sliced without skin (thank god) over the top of the salmon along with prawns, crab meat, cucumber, avocado, & tobiko (if I'm not mistaken). I had the appetizer tempura which had 2 large prawns & a good variety of colourful veg which was very welcomed. It was fresh & the sauce was flavoursome. My food was served with a nice hot miso soup to start & the service was very polite & welcoming. I'd definitely come back hungry.
author: Julian I.

description:
My favorite sushi spot in Jtown.
It is very clean inside and service is always good.
I love their special rolls but my fave would have to be the Korean Chirashi aka Hwe Dup Bab.
They are also probably one of the few sushi restaurants in the area that stay open late.
author: C P.

description: Tried this place while in Japantown for dinner.  They weren't that busy so we got seated right away.  I ordered their tonkatsu but I was not impressed.  I don't know what it was but I didn't like the taste.  I was disappointed because I love tonkatsu - it's one of my favorite dishes so because of that I am writing this review.  My friends ordered their chicken katsu curry and it looked like beef stew.  Curry is normally thicker but it was very liquidity.  Our waitress was friendly but the food quality was bad.
author: Mikayla M.

description: Nasty waitress, the one with the grey boy short hair. She gave me a dirty glass of water, luckily I saw it and I didn't drink from it. It has lipstick stains on it, and I took pictures of it too to prove. She didn't like me because I come in with my partner and she likes him, I noticed how she always liked him. Beware of this waitress! I won't be eating here anymore. Their food is not great anyway, so I won't be missing out on anything.
author: Sam T.

description: They were very accommodating of our very large group, but the food wasn't memorable. I got the oyako don ($11) and was pretty meh about it--it was filling, but the flavours were mediocre. The miso soup was good. The good thing is that this is right next to Playground, and I imagine it would be much tastier after a few hours of karaoke.
author: Yves L.

description:
BE AWARE, this restaurant charges 18% tips automatically.

We were a table of 3 and ordered 3 items. 
The dynamite roll tasted so bad that we each only had one piece.
The lion king roll was hot on top and cold at the bottom. FYI, it's was baked in the oven. I guess they didn't bake it long enough, or just that they didn't care about the quality of food enough. 
Ramen was ok. 

Overall was not a good dinning experience. Food quality alone I would give it a two stars. Service 3 stars. 

And now comes the tricky part. When we got the tab and trying to figure out how much to tip, i noticed a "automatic gratuity". They charge us 18% tips, without even telling us. THIS IS TOTALLY BS!!!!! I know restaurants charge 15% tips by default if there is a big party. However, we only had 3 people. SHAME ON YOU!!!! A lot of people pay their tabs without looking at the details. I guess it's time for us all to change this habit otherwise we would be taken adVantage by shady business like this one. I cannot imagine how many people pays an 18% + 1x% tips without themselves noticing. I will never go back, and hope others would avoid this restaurant as well.
author: Hansen L.

description:
Came here for my friend's birthday dinner and had a blast! 
Great location in the heart of Japantown and they have variety selection of rolls and sashimi.
I love how they also serve Soju!!
I would definitely come back for more sashimi and soju
author: isaac l.

description: One of the worst experience ever!  Food was mediocre and service is horrible.  We have two families with 5 kids.  We need to beg for 20 minutes to get them water and forks!  The lady with short hair was plain rude and giving us the "look" throughout the night.  Yet, I am forced to pay 18% "automatic tips" because of the party size.  Will never go back again!!!
author: Bill L.

description: This place is great. Love the friendly atmosphere. Food is great. This place has been around and knows how to do sushi. The wait staff is very attentive. Will come back as a regular!
author: max c.

description:
Came here on last Friday night around 7:00 pm.
There are a lot of choice with very reasonable price.
We order 49 roll, J -town it's pretty good.
The unagi don is awesome.
Service was quick and courteous .
Will definitely come back again.
author: Naomi L.

description: Went here to eat since most restaurants were closed because of Labor Day. The employees were welcoming but I have to say that most of the food we ordered were tasteless that we couldn't even finish them. It's really saddening that we paid hella (+charged tip) but didn't get to enjoy any of our food. Never going back here again.
author: Sharen H.

description: Amazing hand ikura roll! Crisp seaweed, salty roe, fresh rice - presented on a handsome hand roll display tray. Highly recommend!
author: Jeff H.

description:
You know where you wait for the light at Post in front of the cobblestones of Buchanan Mall when you walk out of Japan Center? Sanppo was always in the corner of my eye never eliciting much excitement as I presumed it was one of those old-timey J-town eateries that caters to the most undiscriminating tourists. I'm not sure what motivated Jamie W. and me to try it after all these years, but we had a weak moment when nothing else was really striking a chord with us. Besides, Jamie wanted some katsu curry.

We entered, and as expected, the tables looked clumped together haphazardly, and the furniture looked rather worn. But it was pretty crowded with what appeared to be regular customers who appear quite devoted to the relatively reasonable prices to be found here. We started with a $5.50 order of Gyoza, a half-dozen pan-fried which was exactly what we wanted (photo: http://bit.ly/1o3ypOa). True to his word, Jamie ordered the $13.95 Tonkatsu Beef Curry which came with the curry sauce almost overflowing from the dinner plate (photo: http://bit.ly/22tfsHz).

It was decent enough though too watery for my taste. My mom would have rolled her eyes if she had lids. It came with a bowl of iceberg lettuce salad with miso dressing and another bowl of miso soup (photo: http://bit.ly/1VysZZg). Standard stuff really, but they hit the spot. I actually had better luck with the $16.95 Nasu Hasami Yaki, which combined a good amount of grilled beef strips with fried eggplant (photo: http://bit.ly/1pZcjxX). It was a carnivorous blend that worked for me with rice, soy sauce and a side seaweed salad. I also got the same salad/soup combo to start.

You would think that was enough, but no, we also split a $6.95 order of the Hamaichi Negi Maki which was definitely on the meh side as we weren't tasting a great deal of freshness from the sea (photo: http://bit.ly/1T4RyMJ). All in all, we were not overly disappointed by our experience here. If you want decent enough Japanese food that's a couple of cuts above Tokyo Express, then Sanppo works in a pinch. Jamie and I actually came back a month later though that had more to do with Jamie liking the familiar when he goes out to eat.

FOOD - 3 stars...pretty predictable dishes served here, some good, some not as much
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...tired-looking is the most charitable thing to say
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...speedy if somewhat brusque at times
TOTAL - 3 stars...not as bad as you would expect but no omakase here
author: Ed U.

description: Korean owned Japanese restaurant? Miso ramen was bland.  No meat,  no flavor.  I don't recommend eating ramen here if you're a ramen purist.
author: Tony L.

description: Sometimes when I am hungry, it is often the place to stop. There is a Kimberley serving person among the employees there and she was very kind and always good. She always cared about what I would eat. I recommend the Kimberly. She will tell you what is delicious and what is fresh.
author: Sunny N.

description:
Another Japantown fav. I come here after Bay Jiu-Jitsu classes quite often. Usually get the salmon teriyaki bento box with avocado rolls, veggie tempura, soup, rice, and salad. I also always get a cup of warm green tea.

Really friendly staff and fast service.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Incredibly rude, lower class service.  Walked out!!!
Family from out of town were blown away at the attitude and rude service with how everyone was treated. The waitress literally asked us to order faster. Everyone got up and left. They informed the waitress and said we are not happy with this type of service and therefore we are walking out.
author: H. M.

description:
Points for being open when everyone else is closed. Even in a city as cosmopolitan as San Francisco, it can still be hard to feed yourself after 9 o'clock. My friend describe this place has the Denny's of sushi, and I don't believe she is wrong. A late-night Japanese diner.

It wasn't yet 10:00 and not that busy but the waitress talked about it the rush as though it was the middle of the night and she was swamped. I asked for water and she said "we have green tea." Okay. So we got lukewarm green tea and no water.

My friend convinced me to order cooked sushi, because she didn't trust the raw sushi. I agreed even though it sort of defeats the point, and we got some kind of special that had salmon and was deep-fried. I thought just the fish would be fried but the whole roll was fried! Weird. It was falling apart, super hot in the middle with cold-ish rice, but I was hungry and ate it all. It was served on an iceberg lettuce salad.

We also ordered two side salads, seaweed and a cooked spinach with sesame sauce dish. The seaweed salad never came and the spinach was pretty good. Got the job done. The best part was the cute dishes. We had to ask for bill and then for the seaweed salad to be taken off. And I was still thirsty.
author: Angelique L.

description:
Sanppo is the place to go in sf if u r craving sushi and udon noodles. I've been coming here for few yrs now and especially their spicy gomoku udon with nogori sake is one of my favorites!! I strongly recommend this place.
Sanppo rocks!
author: J K.

description: One of my favorite restaurant is Sanppo in the Japan town !!! I've enjoyed there several years!! Especially I like to eat shush special ! There are many kind of dishes that was delicious !! Even the restaurant open until midnight !! I love there!!
author: Myung K.

description: Great Food and Great Service!!! I was greeted at the door and we were impressed. My kids weren't very much into eating food like this, so I was surprised that they left the plate EMPTY!!! Also, it's in Japantown,". 5 STARS
author: Chris M.

description: Ordered the miso ramen and California roll. The miso ramen's broth didn't taste like miso nor was it ramen noodle. The sushi was ok, the crab meat had a funny taste to it. Truly disappointed.
author: Kristi A.

description:
Worst food and service ever in Japan town.
I ordered the combination bento box dinner for take out. 
The menu shows that it comes with salad and miso soup....no miso in my box. The beef and chicken teriyaki were over cooked and tough to chew. 
The sauce was the worst teriyaki flavor. I had better food at Kippu near by.
author: Michael L.

description:
This is one of the few Japanese places that open until midnight or 1am (except Sundays where it's 10am). So my friend and I stopped in for a very late dinner.  We had miso soup, rainbow roll, and a baked salmon roll.

The miso soup and rainbow roll are what you'd expect at any restaurant.  Both tasted pretty good.  The Lionking (baked salmon) roll was outstanding and unexpected. I definitely would recommend this roll if you want something different.  There's just something about the way the salmon baked in foil wrap combined with the avocado, crab meat, and tobiko that made it quite appetizing.

Our only complaint is that the soup spoons that came with the miso soup tasted like detergent. but the staff quickly replaced it.  The smell of the kitchen at the time was also heavy with detergent but hopefully this isn't an ongoing problem.
author: Nick A.

description:
We went on a Saturday night at dinner time during the Cherry Blossom festival. It was probably the only place within walking distance that had no wait (lol - red flag there?). Got seated, took 15 minutes for someone to take our drink orders and we got impatient so we ordered then and there. 

The food is overly pricey for the quality of the sushi. It was not fresh at all and definitely not worth what they were charging for. Spicy mayo really tasted like plain-o mayo you get from the supermarket. And the server never came to check up on us so we had to get up and flag one down to get our check. We pre-calculated the amount and left decent change for tip (even though there was no service at all). The lady told us to wait and handed us the actual bill where a table of two was auto-grated 18% tip. Wtf?!? It's not even right to auto grat when you've done nothing to provide service that's up to par and deserving of that. Not okay. My sister and I paid the bill, handed to her, and she said 'okay' and walked away. Not even a thank you for giving this very disappointing restaurant a chance. I can see how they're still even in business cause the location is good. But food.. 1 star. Service...0 stars because I can't review something that I didn't even receive. They'll rob you blindly if you go here. 

Learned my lesson of trying new places without checking Yelp.
author: Cindy N.

description:
I came here with my friends during the day of Christmas Eve. It was one of the few places open so we decided to give it a try. 

We ordered our food. Everyone got their food except one person. We waited for a few minutes so that our friend can eat with us, but we were hungry so we started eating. We kept asking the servers about our friend's food but we kept getting brushed off. 

By the time we finished our food, our friend's food came. At that point, we were so mad we tried to talk to the manager. He came at us in such an angry and disrespectful manner, yelling at us while telling us that the food came. The fact that my friend's food came half an hour later seemed insignificant to him. 

It was the worst experience I've had in a restaurant. Keep reading the other reviews here and you'll find that this is not a rare occurrence. We should've checked the reviews first before stepping inside this crappy restaurant. 

I'll never come back here.
author: Dean S.

description:
Not sure why the low ratings but I thought it was okay.

Nothing else was opened and I was starving so I decided to go into the first opened place I see. Behold, I find Sannpo. I was greeted and sat down. Since it was pretty empty, the waitresses were attentive.

Between two of us, we ordered gyzoza and two special rolls. The unagi on top of one of the sushi was huge and fresh. The roll with raw salmon was okay --not crazy fresh but the salmon wasn't old either. Left really full and content, and I think the only downside is that it's a little more on the pricier side.
author: Julian Y.

description: We came here to eat during the Cherry Blossom Festival to eat here. The food was great and the wait staff was good too. The festival put a strain on their resources so things were a bit slow and requests for items needed to be repeated once or twice but they do make good teriyaki bowls. But no worries, we got there just in time to eat our lunch before the crowd set in again.
author: Jason C.

description: Horrible food, horrible service. Chicken broth ramen tasteless, pork inside tasted sour and had rotten smell. Grilled Salmon was dry and fishy. Chicken katsu was fried in oil which was not fresh.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Avoid if possible, this place is just dingy and just screams "I'M REALLY OUTDATED". Ordered a chicken dish and it was not what I was expecting... I hate wasting food, but that dish I just couldn't eat anymore. I just felt dirty being in here and just wanted out. 

Only reason we stopped by here was that it was close by our hotel and we didn't want to travel far just to eat since everything seemed to be closed.
author: Tina T.

description:
Attentive service, good food and incredibly cheap price. There are not many places in SF where you can spend only around $10 for a full meal. 

I recommend nabe and gyoza
author: Hyunha K.

description: The prices were pretty steep compared to most places when it came to sushi. I ended up ordering the udon noodles as it was less expensive. I wasn't huge fan of it. The tempura tasted like stale oil which kind of threw me off. The salad dressing they out on the salads was very heavy and tasted like straight up mayo. I didn't finish it. My soup came out fast and was piping hot. Had to wait a minute for it to cool down. The service was good and they were very attentive and nice.
author: Leah A.

description:
Japanese food, especially sushi, is one of my favorite cuisines and sadly this was one of my least memorable experiences.

Came here once for lunch about a year ago with a few friends when we were in the Japantown area. We ordered a few rolls to share. One of the rolls we ordered had raw salmon, which had a very strange taste - definitely did not taste fresh. Also, the presentation of the rolls was terrible - the rolls were messy and disordered and the rice was extremely mushy.

The service was bad. The waiters took a long time to take our order, the chefs took a long time to make our sushi, and the bill took forever to arrive. And we didn't even go at a peak hour.
author: Alvin W.

description: We chose this place for an out of town teen friend who had never had sushi before. The food was very good, especially my swamp roll (spicy tuna with seaweed salad and tobiko), and our friend is now a fan. But the five stars are really for the service: we were with my teen autistic son who was having a hard day. The staff was consistently courteous and friendly to him. When a baby at a table started crying, which is very hard for my son to tolerate and which makes him upset because he feels others' emotions very strongly, and we had to leave quickly, the staff was efficient and kind and non-judgmental in helping us get out the door *fast*. It is not always easy for us to eat in restaurants, especially if we have a crisis, so I appreciate the staff supporting or family.
author: Shannon R.

description:
I can't believe this place has such a low stars.
People there are really nice, the food come fast and is tasty. It's one of the best sushi in my opinion. The place is simple and comfy!
author: Luana H.

description: I can deal with the food not being great - what really got me was seeing the waitress pick something off my plate with her bare hand, put it into the trash and then serve it to me.
author: Jackalina A.

description:
This is one of those spots where you come late at night after some hanging and drinking with friends. Service was okay with waiters quick to assist & the quality of food was okay too . The Ika Fry (calamari) was the chef's special. More like the chef needed to get rid of it (way too chewy). My lady and I had ordered 2 bento boxes + Ika Fry, damaging in roughly $35 total. I live in NY, so i wont be coming back. 

:)
author: Leo S.

description: Worst food I've had in a long time. Very dry and bland. I didn't eat more than 5 bites of the sukiyaki. Baked Salmon roll was dry and the katsu was below par. Don't waste your time & money here
author: Roman K.

description:
Terrible sushi quality. Their fish is obviously not fresh at all. Nigiri was okay, but the rainbow roll was the worst I've had. The color of the dishes were not right.

Service is alright. I expected a little bit better quality and service for Japantown. I'm not coming back to this restaurant though.
author: Jenny H.

description: The food was good and it came out really quick! Service could have been better (I.e. Asking for water refills and picking up the bill instead of me bringing it to them). Parking can be a little difficult too!
author: Emily S.

description: Quick but before catching a movie. If you want a quick bite then yep come here. Can't believe an order of uni costs more than my triple item bento meal. The uni was just eh.
author: Ed M.

description:
Yay, Sushi!

To be completely honest, it was one of the first places we saw, and we decided to try it out right then and there. We were feeling rather adventurous. It wasn't busy at all considering it was 2 or 3 in the afternoon, and there was only 1 other family in the restaurant besides us.

The prices were quite a bit better than the other place around the corner, so we were just happy to find a place after all that walking. My friend got some udon, and I got a bento. The price was definitely right!

Her udon was about $7 and my bento was about $10.

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because of the fantastic deal. For a $10 bento, you could order two small rolls as your entree, or some other choice of food. WHAT. I was so full I couldn't eat anymore, even though I tried desperately lol. Service was good, but the bathroom was pretty gross. We had to walk to the shopping center to find a bathroom. (Please clean your bathrooms :-( )

As good as Sanppo was, I probably won't be back soon; I would like to try the other restaurants in this area.
author: Molly M.

description:
My boyfriend and I were just passing through Japan Town for 1 day. While we were waiting for our hotel room to be ready across the street , we walked over to Sanppo for some sushi...
DO NOT GO HERE! 
Reasons why: 
- I ordered a rainbow roll, albacore nigiri and salmon nigiri. It was not fresh at all and was just so fishy tasting I could only eat 2 pieces of the roll and 1 piece of the salmon.(my boyfriend felt the same way)
- From our seats you could see into the kitchen ... I watched the chef who was making the rolls continuously eat food with his bare hands and not wash his hands afterwards. 
- smelled old and fishy when we walked in

That's just a few things that should steer you away lol. There's soooo many other places around here that have great reviews! Sad we didn't take the time to look at this place on here before hand. 

Xx Shelby
author: Shelby B.

description:
You would think in Japantown, you can't go wrong with a sushi restaurant.  My friend was visiting out of town and we came in here around 8 on a weekday and it was pretty empty, so we were glad not to have a wait (but that's what I get for not yelping places first...).  I was hoping to show him quality sushi (he's from rural Pittsburgh where sushi is rare), but in general, we left pretty disappointed.  The meal came with miso soup and a house salad which was great.  However, the sushi wasn't very fresh and was kind of chewy.  The fish that sat on top of the rolls was bare and thin.  The rolls were priced ok, but the quality didn't keep up.   I was disappointed that I promised my friend great sushi and it didn't live up to expectations :( 

On a different note, the rolls were very spicy, and we got great service as the girls kept refilling my empty cup of water.
author: Jenny C.

description: Bad experience. Very unfriendly staff. Not willing to customize order. Then they said the kitchen was closed 30 minutes before closing. Would never recommend
author: Jason H.

description: The sushi's not that great, and it's pretty pricey. Service is pretty bad. It took forever to get my food, and it seemed like they were trying to rush me out the whole time. :/
author: Madeleine M.

description:
Their Japanese food will suffice.  We ordered up their sashimi deluxe, fried chicken appetizer, potstickers, curry udon and bento boxes as entrees.  Everything was good, but not great - it didn't keep me yearning for more!

Their dishes were priced on average in Japantown and service was mediocre.  It took awhile for them to refill my requests on cups of tea and plates for my family to grab food to eat on!

They thanked us when we were all leaving.  It is as if they noticed we were in a large group and couldn't wait to get us out, so thanked us to be leaving.  Well, that's how I thought in my mind.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I ate lunch on Christmas day with a friend. We went in at 2PM and the restaurant was busy but there were at least 3 servers and they were making things move. I ordered beef with curry. When it arrived it had a generous portion of beef, curry and white steamed rice. I attacked the dish but I quickly sensed that one side of is was barely warm so I asked our waitress to warm it up. She took it back but did not attempt to apologize. When the dish came back I could see steam which was a good sign. The beef with curry was good. The only problem was that the curry was probably medium spicy which is too spicy and it sort of ruins the flavor of the dish because it's too potent. It is not just potent but pungent and I don't like that. I can tolerate mild spicy food after eating more and more over the years but when it comes to the point it gets annoying, eating is no more fun. My friend ordered a vegetarian roll. When he ordered a second and I politely asked if it was an appetizer or a main course our waitress started to get defensive and gave me an attitude by saying "it can be anything you want". I would have given 3.5 stars to the business but since they did not heat the food and the waitress was giving me an attitude I can only give 2 stars. On the other hand, the older Korean lady is very polite and she is very good at giving directions to customers when they arrive to speed up the process of attending people.
author: X. Y.

description:
Pretty disappointed in this place. One would think that all restaurants in Japantown would be somewhat decent...psychhhhh. 

The quality of the fish is VERY poor, though presentation sorta hides it. If you eat here I recommend you stay away from the raw stuff/the sushi. Customer service is also pretty bad here....and the waiters don't let you leave unless you give 15% tip (happened to me). This place chipped away a little bit of my soul. 

Please do not go here when you have so many other options within a 2 block distance. The boxed sushi from Nijiya is even better.
author: Anna H.

description:
Decided to try this place out, since we've walked by it 100 times. 
Again, looks like a Denny's. 
We had a couple bento boxes and a couple rolls, some nigiri. 
It was all just OK. Nigiri was pretty stingy compared to some places 20 feet away. 
Rolls were falling apart. 
Price was fair I guess, but for this area, I have high expectations. 
Took forever to get the check, and again, service staff running around like crazy when there were only about 4 tables with people.
author: Adrian M.

description: The absolute NASTIEST food ever. I ordered the Bento box with tonkatsu and the baked salmon roll. The salmon roll was the DRIEST SUSHI ever, and the tonkatsu was very rough to eat. The food tastes old. Not worth time/money.
author: Dana S.

description: Great place, great food, very nice people. Not sure why other gave low scores. We eat here regularly and always came away happy and full.
author: David S.

description:
As anyone knows, I'm a HUGE fan of sushi. Right after we landed in SF for our girls weekend, we checked into our rental house - in Japantown. Of course after all that traveling, a happy hour and fresh sushi was in order! A friend found this little place and we noshed there. Here are the takeaways:

1. The service is poor. the tiny restaurant was busy, but we were able to find a table for 5 of us just fine. our server came to us after about 10 minutes, and ordered water, as we looked at the menu. she didn't return for a good 20 minutes and left half way through our sushi order. she said to "push the button" if we needed her....which we did many times, yet we rarely saw her.

2. Food is amazing and fresh. we ordered a handful of different rolls to share amongst us and it was delicious. spicy tuna, avacado, veggie, unagi and more fill our plates and our bellies. SO GOOD.

3. Prices are pretty decent. the ones we ordered were much cheaper than their fancy rolls, yet just as good. they do offer bento boxes and full meals as well, for a good price too. only downside? NO HAPPY HOUR. sad day.

4. It's located right in the heart of Japantown and walking distance from our house! 

Overall - this place was decent. i wouldn't return if i'm ever back in the city, but it was a great introduction to the cities selection of fresh fish :)
author: Katie F.

description:
We were happy to find Sanppo was open after 9, but our experience was not a good one. Our order took forever to arrive, and when it did so, one person got  their meal well ahead of the next one, and finally, close to an hour later, the last person's roll arrived. A simple sushi roll!. Meanwhile, other tables were served their food. The servers tried to make up for it by bringing us seaweed salad and miso soup on on the house. That was nice but unfortunately overshadowed by the worst edamame we have ever had. I don't know if they were sitting around for hours or defrosted in the microwave, or what. But they were mushy and tasteless. Luckily the sushi was actually decent, fresh. 
Then we got the bill and they had automatically added an 18% tip.... for a table of three, and a regular dinner, not ok. Up until that moment I was giving the servers the benefit of the doubt, but that was the last straw. I used to think bad restaurants can't survive in SF, somehow this one has.
author: ilena f.

description:
Beware! They will include 18%tip on your bill without you knowing. They add it automatically when they swipe your card and when you sign you could mistakenly add more tip. There is really no service for them to deserve the 18%. 

Food is just ok, nothing extraordinary.
author: Gee M.

description:
Came here around 3pm on a Thursday, it wasn't crowded, maybe like 3 or 4 other tables. First we didn't have enough chopsticks (party of 5 plus a baby and they gave us a fork and 3 chopsticks). We had to ask more than once for the extra chopstick. Anyways, we ordered 4 bento boxes (2 salmon teriyaki, 1 beef teriyaki and 1 chicken teriyaki) and my nephew ordered a lion king roll and I had an extra philly roll. The rolls came out first. Nothing outstanding, the wasabi want even spicy. 

The salmon included in the bento was so incredibly small- it was ridiculous and hardly any teriyaki sauce. The California rolls that came with it were absolutely disgusting. Tasted soggy and were very sloppily made. The beef and chicken were very small as well.

While we were eating we ran out of water, we pressed the little button and it took FOREVER for the waitress to come and refill our glasses. She even kept running into the back of my chair without saying excuse me. 

Our check came super fast and they added on their own tip. I will advice you all to not come here. There are way better places to get sushi. The supermarket on the corner has better sushi than this place.
author: Jo C.

description: One of the worst sushi roll I ever ate. Rainbow roll was definitely not fresh and tasted very fishy. Couldn't eat more than 2 pieces. I hope I won't get food poisoning tonight. Furniture looks worn and dinghy. Atmosphere of an old rundown Denny's chain restaurant. Completely over priced for this kind of food quality and ambience. Service and opining hours are fine.
author: Steffen N.

description: The place looked inviting from the outside and we are on a journey to try out all the sushi places in Japantown since we moved around the area. I love sashimi but this place really turned me off from sashimi for a while. I'm not an expert on sashimi but even I could tell the fish wasn't too fresh. Doug got a giant roll and that was more of a 3/5. Overall, we wouldn't be coming back and look forward to what the rest of Japantown has to offer
author: Felicia C.

description: We entered extremely hungry and left extremely full!  We ordered the San Francisco roll ($11.95), k-pop roll($12.95), and 2 bowls of tempura udon ($11.50 each).  The tempura came out first. There was sweet potato, shrimps broccoli, and some other veggies that I couldn't identify. It was good though, except the broccoli; it was too soft for my liking. The udon was pretty basic--noodles, some leafy veggies, soup. It was still good though and hit the spot! The rolls were the best! I enjoyed the San Francisco roll more than the K-pop roll. The San Francisco roll is an unagi (eel) roll. So saucy and flavorful. The k-pop roll had spicy tuna(?) topped with a slice of mango. I love mango! This place was conveniently located across the street from our hotel. We looked at other restaurants nearby and some received extremely poor health marks (according to Yelp) so we opted to not get food poisoning and go to sanppo. Good life choice that night!
author: Christina T.

description:
This place is terrible!

First off, the older lady host/waitress is beyond rude, there's no air conditioning in the restaurant whatsoever, and the food is incredibly disgusting.

My sisters and I came here only because we were shopping in Japantown, and wow, was it a big mistake. We walked in, no greeting and we actually sat ourselves. I ordered the bento box and my sisters ordered the dynamite roll, my food came out first and was not very appetizing, the gyoza was super tiny and my grilled salmon roll was mushy. Almost like 15 mins later, my sisters finally got their rolls and what was upsetting was the sushi was soggy and mushy, it was so disgusting that they barely touched the rolls. To make matters worse, we sat and waited almost 40mins for our check, we politely asked the lady twice for it and come on, it doesn't take that long to input the damn check. Sorry not sorry. Will not be returning and will never recommend this place. If you're in Japantown, get sushi or ramen elsewhere.
author: Julia K.

description: My best friend and I have come here several times and have always had a wonderful experience. Good is very affordable and delicious. Most of all the service is wonderful. They are always so nice and attentive to our dining experience. We love a good Salmon Skin Roll and didn't see it on the menu and they went above and beyond and made it for us. Love this place!
author: Oliver S.

description:
really nice reataurant! not too crowded and waitress are really nice ever! food is also fresh
restaurant is really clean! I've been here with my friend and I had such a nice day
author: Juyeon K.

description: Had lunch sushi special on a Friday. One piece of fish was a little tough. The snapper? The rest seemed ok. Five hours later having had nothing else to eat since lunch I got food poisoning and couldn't hold anything down. My guys were twisted in knots. Had to cancel a date I'd just arrived for. Actually had to run to the bathroom of the restaurant where I met her. And it was not a pretty scene in there. Apologized and went straight home. Haven't had food poisoning in many years. Don't want to again. Won't be going back there.
author: David A R.

description:
Our server was helpful enough and the food came out fast. We ordered the rainbow roll and the K-pop roll, saba sioyaki and soba with chicken; complimentary tea, miso shiru, and salad were served before. Unfortunately, we were disappointed with most everything we got. The tea, soup, and salad were not bad, but they weren't good, either. The crab salad in the rainbow maki was okay, but none of the fish in either roll seemed very fresh or flavorful; the soba was lackluster as well. The one reasonably tasty item was the saba; it was grilled nicely, with a crisp skin but not overdone.

We were hungry and ate what we were served, but regretted spending money ($50 plus tip) on a meal that I enjoyed about as much as I would have a Subway sandwich; it was that mediocre. Maybe some of their other menu items are good, but we won't be going back to find out. Two stars for the saba and the service, Sanppo.
author: Kelly P.

description:
Oowhee, this place was soul sucking. I came here late at night with a girlfriend; we were staying nearby and got into town pretty late, so not much was open in walking distance. We opted for the arguably aptly-named Sannpo because it was before either of us used Yelp. Lol. Here was our experience dining here:
* It was not clean. Visible layer of lint on the windows and lightning. Not only was it not clean, but there was some sort of a small, dead animal and in the light fixture above our table which I (quietly) addressed to our server before leaving (and after paying). Empty tables still stacked with dishes for some time after guests left.
*No one serving or preparing food was wearing gloves. Our server handed my soup out with her thumb in the dam.. Bowl. My friend's sushi tray looked slick. She did not finish her food, she said it tasted bland and gave her a stomach ache halfway through. My soup tasted like tepid eye drops. Our place settings were "recycled" but not in a good way.
*No visible health department badge or business license.
*Our server was kinda confrontational; had an attitude the entire time she waited our table. After I unintentionally gave the incorrect amount of change on our order, she called me an idiot, twice. Once in English and the first time in Korean. Why did I have to tip after that?

We went other places the next day that made up for it, but this place sucked worse than having to run to Walmart at two a.m., if you can imagine. I try to be pretty fair about the fact that I'm apparently more difficult to please than most, but these people really went out of their way to be awful n TBH I still get mad thinking about this bc my friend didn't deserve that. The good news is I did it so you don't have to and I never have to do it again!
author: Autumn M.

description: Solid sushi. Not the best I've ever had, which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. But the prices are very affordable, service was fast, location is convenient, and the sushi was very good! Wasabi is not very strong either so you can shovel it into your mouth without feeling like your tongue will burn off
author: Jennifer B.

description: I highly recommend it if you want some simple sushi and bento, a good cozy place to spend the cold SF night in with a good friend or all alone. They serve free tea with their food, with some better ceramics now! It's got a great homey ambience with terrific service (free miso, tea, and pickled cabbage!) plus a tv playing softly in the background. It's now clean and well lit! It's the perfect place if you want a quiet Japanese-style pub for the night.
author: Jacob W.

description: Crappy.  Not Japanese run.  Unfortunately, ate here twice (was with family).  First time (I know, why order Chinese?) I had garlic chicken over rice.  It was some of the plainest most ordinary Chinese food I've eaten.  We also split a few sushi rolls.  Unfortunately, every roll was "contaminated" with mayo (I HATE mayo).  Every roll!  The second time I had a combo of beef teriyaki and some other unmemorable dish.  Plain is the best I can rate the food.  Why people would willingly go to Sanppo more than once is a mystery.  There IS much better Japanese food around Japantown.  Skip this place.
author: Tim L.

description:
It's just bad. All bad. Bad food and bad service. Each of us had the Bento box dinner.
While the individual items carried a Japanese name. Tonkatsu and Saba misoyaki, bore little taste and quality resemblance to those served by any of the other "Japanese" restaurants in J town. 

Service was as described by other reviewers: rude, unprofessional, sad. Service was so bad, it was uncomfortable.
author: Matsuo U.

description: My friends and I were looking around Japan Town for something to eat and decided to check this little restaurant out. The wait for the food wasn't so bad (there was 8 of us altogether) and they got the food out to us around 15mins. The sushi rolls are good! I saw some reviews that said it wasn't that great but honestly I can say I'd go back for their sushi again. The waitress are polite too and that's a plus. The ramen was kinda bland but maybe that's just me I have high expectations. [Noodle lover here]
author: Rayne V.

description: Place has really upped their game since last year. Much cleaner, better service and better food. Worth a try despite the bad review history
author: Alex M.

description:
Horrible customer service!!!!!
Meh food
No acknowledgment and took 20 mins to grab the bill
author: Adrian L.

description:
Typical tourist place with a lot of "rolls" on the menu, slightly above-average prices, and a large menu selection of random choices (none of which the restaurant is specialized in).

The place in and of itself is not bad, but there are many other better Japanese food places nearby, so I would say skip this place as much as possible, because much better food is just a few steps away
author: Henry L.

description:
We had a wide assortment of entrees. Sushi, Bento, tempura, fermented pickle, miso, ramen, wakame. Everything was good and the service was excellent. The 49er roll
Was especially refreshing. Would definitely go back.
author: Edi M.

description:
Pretty mediocre place considering it's prime location. I would think that being in San Francisco, being in Japantown, this would be prime sushi. Truthfully, though, I don't find it to be superior to sushi I've had in landlocked locations in the midwest.

Don't get me wrong, it's not bad... but certainly not special enough to warrant a return visit. I go about once every three years because I'm right there and with someone who wants sushi.
author: Sean B.

description:
Nope, nope, nope.

The only reason we ended up here was because we were being indecisive and decided to walk into the first restaurant we saw. #terribledecision

I ordered the chirashi and while it looked okay, the quality of the fish was terrible. The texture was weird, and the taste was suspicious. Honestly, it was hard to stomach and I'm not sure if I'll be sick later. My head also started hurting half way through the dinner although that could have been entirely unrelated...

The miso soup was decent and the salad was fine but a bizarre tasting tomato did find its way into my bowl. 

Avoid.
author: Yanni L.

description:
I order salmon teriyaki and I am really dissapointed. 
And the waitresses are rude and they take too long just for the water to be served. I will never come back to this restaurant.
author: zorabel c.

description:
Very yummy miso soup. I thought the pork gyoza were okay but my boyfriend loved them. My Island Roll was great, but they never brought it until I asked again. Some sort of mistake. They brought 2 more miso soups and a seaweed salad to make up for it, which was nice.

They sat us in a semi-secluded part of the restaurant, so service was infrequent. Overall, the food was good and I would return.
author: Alexandra W.

description: Ugh I finally have time to finish this review lmao! Anyways, I came here after volunteering at the cherry blossom festival with my friends back in April. Got seated pretty quick. I got the fish cake udon and unagi roll while two of my friends got ramen and my other friend got a rice dish. It was pretty busy that day so I would understand that it would take a bit for food to come out. Once we actually got our food, it was just okay. My friends did not like the ramen and thought it lacked flavor. The friend who ordered the rice dish was still hungry because they gave such small portions. The udon I got was just okay...definitely could've been better. What docked off a star I could've given to make this review a 3-star, would be that while we were eating, there was one customer who was seated at a table and while they went to use the restroom real quick, a server basically moved their belongings to a different table just so a bigger party could sit at the table that the one customer was just at. I couldn't believe my eyes...I just found that to be very rude. You can't just move someone's stuff, let alone touch someone's stuff without their permission! All in all, I will never come back lol
author: Coco L.

description: Food was okay but a little on the pricey side, sushi is generally expensive but think we could've found better quality since it was averagely priced. It's a nice little place though and not very busy so if you're looking for low key and quiet this would be a good destination.
author: Sierra S.

description: The shop is in Japan town. The atmosphere inside is warm and sweet. There is a TV inside, too. The offer sushi, all kinds of rice and noodles. They offer free Japanese miso soup. I ordered dragon rolls. OMG! It tastes so good. Really deserves a try.
author: Nancy S.

description: What a mistake to have had lunch here with my family today. Nothing we ordered was good. Ramen soup was just soy sauce added to water. Fried chicken was not Japanese style -- KFC is much better. Salad sauce was disgusting. Will not return, even though the waitresses were polite.
author: Edward S.

description:
Thank you, Sanppo, for being regularly open till 1 am (on New Year's Eve Saturday too) and being the only late-night Japantown place to take my Korean friends who wanted to eat "anything but Korean". Well, I initially walked them into Dosa but was unable to convin$$$e them to stay.

On other occasions, I've been here with groups as big as 15ish and as small as just 2. I've had service ranging from friendly to "where are they?". I don't necessarily set this place in my mind and plan around it - it's usually an impromptu or convenience thing.

Rating Breakdown:
3 stars for the food.
4 stars for the hours.
2 stars for the staff's teasing Hite aprons. This place doesn't have Hite.
author: Dan B.

description:
Was a little skeptic about the restaurant due to the ratings but the place is great and deserves 5 stars.
Great food, fresh fish, large choice and top service. The waitresses were very attentive to detail and arranged a custom order for us free of charge. I will go again!
author: Claire M.

description: Adequate food.  Ordered two bento boxes.  We tried to inquire about their other dishes, but communication is definitely a challenge so we stuck to traditional food.  Salmon was a little over cooked and the tempura was very good.  Sushi was fresh. We're not familiar with the area so we decided to give this place a try.  I would probably go somewhere else if given the choice.
author: Bevin H.

description: Delicious gyoza, fast service, awesome deep fried sushi (coit tower roll). Hit the spot. If I wasn't a tourist id be here every week. And affordable!!!
author: Neal L.

description: Great place!! The food was great and so was the service. The wait staff was very kind and was very happy to answer any questions we had. The sushi was amazing. For dessert definitely have the mochi ice cream!!! Will come again next time in Japantown!
author: Myrah S.

description: If I could I wouldn't give it any stars. Always came here at noon. My wife and i went during dinner,  because we both were available.  Never have we ever been ignored. Took 10 mins for them to take our order. Then another 30 mins pass, serving everyone around us and all their orders and new ones.  My wife and i walked out,  they didn't even notice as we looked at them going out.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Fish is not fresh at all ... spat out some of the sashimi ... Then just stopped eating ... The rolls are passable ... maybe slightly better than grocery store ones ...

We did mention to the waiter that the fish was not fresh and he offered to give us other sashimi but we rather not get any more yucky fish ... would've appreciated it more if they gave us a discount instead since the food is overpriced for the quality.
author: Joyce C.

description: Hard to choose from all these restaurants in Japan  town. Decided on this one (without checking on yelp) and really liked it. We had a seafood and veggie nabe (soup) was very very very good! We also ordered the swamp roll with was also delicious! Nice service staff as well.
author: Rommy K.

description: I got food poisoning from their pork ramen. Additionally, staff was unfriendly. Overall, a pretty negative experience.
author: Brian D.

description:
Very affordable Japanese food. Very convenient and in the center of Japantown. I've been here a few times before and never had any complaints. It wasn't that crowded for a Saturday night with about 4 other families and the environment wasn't noisy like sometimes restaurants can be.

I ordered a Dinner Box which is a three combination bento box with Saba (Mackerel), Ton Katsu, and Chicken Terriyaki all for about $10 plus of course tax and tip.. but that's pretty affordable! The portions were very satisfying and maybe it's because I ate a little before but my family gobbled up all of theirs. The TonKatsu was a little too fried for me but it wasn't like there was a lot of batter, which was good. Of course the bento box included miso soup, salad, and rice.

Just a cute thing: I went to the restroom and there was a small stack of mini Korean paperback comic books for your enjoyment during your trip to the restroom... sweeeet.
author: Lauren K.

description:
After spending an hour trying to escape out of the Mystery Room next door and miserably failing, my friends and I decided to head to Sanppo to drink our sorrows away. This is your average mediocre sushi joint, and I expected a bit higher quality from a Japantown establishment. Nonetheless, it got the job done.

In the middle of lunch time on a Saturday, our group of 10+ was quickly accommodated and served. Hot sake flasks came out one by one followed with ice cold Sapporo. Even though we were a large group, the service here is efficient and without hassle, contrary to many other reviews.

I ordered a Donburi Special I, which was chicken teriyaki over rice and assorted tempura. Mediocre at best. The chicken was very plain and just had a bit of teriyaki sauce drizzled over it. The portion was a lot less than I expected and would've filled up maybe half of a standard donburi bowl. Tempura was pretty standard as well. Nothing to rave about.

I'm sure there are much better places in J-Town. This works for a large group, but food quality is just so-so.
author: Dmitriy S.

description: I always love this place for their udo and i usually i go in the afternoon. Now im pretty sure the afternoon staff knows me by now but me and my fiancé went tonight and the night staff took forever. They catered to just certain tables and kept bringing out dishes and we didn't even get a roll and we were waiting for 40 min. We left without getting anything.
author: Daeday T.

description:
Sushi in Japantown. What could be better?!

I came here with my family when we were visiting relatives. It's been so long that I don't remember my exact order. I do remember being the only one who didn't get a bento box. That being said, I really wish I had. I just ordered 2 rolls, and they were good but nothing to write home about. 

Very cute location in a cool part of town.
author: Racquel D.

description: The customer service was junk. The food was ok, not worth the money and they automatically charge the tip on your bill. Unsatisfied with the overall service. There was a absolutely no crowed and the wait was long. Never eating here again.
author: Vianey C.

description: Took over an hour for our food!! Not only that, they even forgot one of friend's order -___- if we hadn't asked them again, I'm sure they wouldn't even bother to make it for her. Yet they took our check in a heartbeat. Never coming back here again.
author: Lana T.

description: Started enjoying this place ages ago and it has yet to disappoint. Love the plentiful good food, reasonable prices, nice and accommodating staff.
author: V D.

description: Thoroughly adequate Japanese food in a cozy (read: small and crowded) setting that is comfy enough, conveniently right across from the J-Town Mall. Service was pleasant if a bit absent-minded, food was okay, this place is not really a destination but fine if you're hungry and in the area.
author: Tom B.

description:
Open late!  I wanted a quiet relaxing dinner and Sanppo delivered.  Unfortunately I didn't try any of the sashimi, but the bento box was tasty at a nice price.  
Service here is nice as well.  I'll be back in the future for a more thorough review.
author: Garrett M.

description:
The service was great! I just wished they spoke better english and understood it better. 

We ordered the bento box lion king roll and the sanppo roll? I forget. 

Their bento box is super cheap during lunch! I got chicken katsu and salmon teriyaki and it was pretty good. I just wished the chicken had more meat in it and the salmon was a little bigger.

I love how they do not skimp the rolls! I love how they put a large amount of fish on my rolls!
author: Diem T.

description:
The food is actually pretty good and in the past the service has been acceptable. The prices are average for San Francisco. 

1 star because when you plan your evening around their 1130am to 12midnight listed hours and you are prevented from entering because "we are closed" 30 minutes early it will ruin your night.

I will return but with the knowledge that they are not true to their word.
author: David C.

description: Poor service. Our server was not friendly and made us feel like a burden every time we asked for anything such as more tea or small plates. Shouldn't they be giving this to us as a normal service? Server didn't respond when we asked for things and just walked away. She did bring the plates and tea but didn't speak to us very much. Ramen and miso soup were very salty. Noodles were soggy. Salmon sushi was fresh and good. Otherwise, would not recommend this place.
author: Jacqui C.

description: Is zero stars an option? This was by far the WORST Japanese food I have ever had. The service quality was met with the quality of the food...just awful. I only ordered apps and left...the small salad was basically iceberg lettuce with mayonnaise on it. It was disgusting. I ordered a miso soup, it was cold. Lastly, I got the tempura veggies & shrimp, and was afraid to eat the shrimp given the quality of the first 2 dishes. The best part of the meal was the (much needed) beer. It was $25 for all that, and I reluctantly paid for the gross food and left. DON'T go here!
author: Jayna F.

description: Love this place! The hostess is one of the nicest women I have ever met. The sushi is very great, fairly inexpensive, only problem is honestly the ambiance. Not perfect, but food is worth it! Highly recommended.
author: Clay P.

description: We were visiting Japan town and were hoping for a delicious meal but were sadly disappointed.  We ordered multiple rolls and several dinners.  The sushi was mushy, falling apart and tasted fishy.  The salmon teriyaki dinner was meh.  If you are looking for good sushi and delicious food this is not the place.
author: R A.

description: The only great thing is that it is open until late. Ika fry was chewy. Bento box price was okay, taste was nothing to rave about. Service was nice, welcoming.
author: Krista I.

description: I've been to here many times. I love every kinds of Sushi here. I believe the price is fairly decent compared to their quality and service. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Sumin C.

description: Although the prices were high, the portions were reasonable, and the food tasted pretty good.  However, when I took a bite of my sushi, a large piece of plastic was there.  Concealed by the sauce, I kept chewing until I realized that it was a piece of plastic.  I immediately spit it out and it looked like a brown plastic bag specimen.  It was about 2×1 inches, and I rushed into the restroom to vomit.  The waitress found out and immediately took it away before I could take a picture to post on yelp.  She said it's 'okay' and 'not a big deal' and gave me a bowl of miso soup.  According to her, the fish is bagged and therefore the plastic is 'sanitary'.  That's it! No formal apology!  I am very disappointed that this happened, and our family outing was ruined. For your reference, this happened on 2/15/2017 .
author: Yelp R.

description: They automatically add 18% gratuity while giving the worst service. Short staffed & no attention to customer needs. Sat down & had just one request to have a glass of water to take my medicine. She cut me short, and said she can't talk with us till she attends to her other tables. It took 15 mintues to have her back & 25 min to get my cup of water. Good thing I wasn't dying of dehydration. We ordered over 90 dollars for 3 people consisting of rolls, tempura, teriyaki plates all of which were below average. Defintely better places in Japanetown and rest of SF.
author: Daryüsch R.

description:
Unprofessional and disrespectful service ruins the otherwise decent food!

My husband and I went there one week ago.  I was sick so I couldn't speak well, so my husband ordered 3 things (2 rolls + sashimi) for us to share. When the order went in one of the servers said (in Korean), "just give one salad, she didn't order anything." We didn't know about this ordering rule, now we do. We're talking about a salad worth maybe 20 cents of lettuce and dressing, nothing more.

When I was looking at the check to see that it was correct, he same server HOVERED over me to wait for my credit card, which was very uncomfortable--never experienced this before, anywhere. She was also silent the entire time interacting with us, the only talking done behind our back in Korean to the other employee.

It really is too bad the good food is ruined by such unprofessional and disrespectful service. This is the second time we've noticed bad mouthing of customers so I doubt we'll be going back until the wait staff changes or she gets and attitude adjustment. Hopefully she's not related to the owner with tenure! Lol
author: Soran R.

description: I used to like this place before, but had a horrible service experience, and have never gone back, why would anyone go to a place where they insult you, after screwing up your order, and make you pay for things you did not order .
author: Yev G.

description: While I was sitting here waiting for my food I decided to look up the previous reviews for this place. They all had one thing in common, they were all just decent. When my food arrived I do have to say I agree. The soup bowl was barely filled up. Then the bento box came. Very small portions of just okay food. The salmon teriyaki was more like salmon with a light teriyaki sauce over it. It was an okay place to go but I won't be coming back.
author: Alice R.

description: Staff is friendly, fish was fresh, service was quick, and the beer was cold. This place seems severely under rated. Yum!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
I understand that this is mediocore. 
I understand that Japantown/San Francisco/California is used to much better Sushi and Asian food in general. 

We could live with it and next time we will try somewhere different, just to try more places. We went there because it was full at Benkyodo and we strolled a few more minutes to find something else. 

The food was not bad and we did not feel ripped of by the quality/price-relation. 
As a party of four we have been treated very well by the staff.
author: Manuel D.

description:
We were skeptical that this restaurant on the main road (Post St.) would be any good.  It looked like a tourist trap from the outside with the sign board on the sidewalk advertising some of the types of food on offer.  It was great that they posted their full menu in a showcase so we knew exactly what they served.  We just wanted bento box lunch combination meals, and if that were so then one of the items we look for is the saba shioyaki.  Thus, Sanppo Restaurant fulfilled our wishes.

Now looking through the entrance door we spotted a few tables that were full.  So we decided to take a chance and try a different Japantown restaurant.  We were given menus when seated, however, it was not until we ordered our food that we were asked what we would like to drink.  Tea and water need to be requested; they are not given upon being seated.  Note:  We were never offered refills.  I assume one needs to request them...

The food was fairly priced, and there were three types of bento box lunches to choose from.  I was disappointed in the tempura as they only give one prawn; every other Japanese restaurant offers two prawns.  The rest of the tempura was just eggplant (tiny piece), carrot, and yam.  The teriyaki beef that came with it was all right albeit on the rare side.  My dining partner had the saba, salmon, and sashimi combination which were all reportedly very good.  We also ordered an Ichiban roll which was good.

Service was efficient, and our server was polite.  However, as mentioned already she did not freely give any refills of water and tea. One probably needs to request it.

Another point to note is that they have clean enough toilets and even better no sharing with another restaurant.  This was welcome after having to deal with the situation when dining at Kushi Tsuru.
author: Luisa T.

description: The miso soup is great. Don't know what they do with it, but it goes in the hatch very well. As for the sushi, don't expect much. This is just another of those, "hey lets go get sushi" but have no idea where the good stuff is at. That being said, the catapillar-like rolls I want to say was very good. They choose pretty heavy avocados or those were nicely slap with unagi and sauce and went really well in my tummy. The other which I believe was lion king was meh to say the least. Nothing special, but if ur hungry, try rolls with avocado. They don't hold back as other places do.
author: Robert H.

description: This restaurant has a nice location in Japantown. I ordered tempura udon. This is my first time eating Japanese food since my trip to Japan. It was just okay compared to the tempura udon I ate in Japan. The tempura was average and the udon was average. It came with a small salad. It wasn't horrible, but not amazing either. The menu has enough of the typical dishes and the prices are a little above average. My friend got fried oysters and he said they were fine.
author: Denise C.

description:
I have no intention to be rude but this is THE place to avoid at all costs!
For the beginning to the end, we had the worst customer service ever by the waitresses. They kept on forgetting items we ordered or asked for, were extremely rude and unprofessional and the service itself was so slow and not efficient. Plus, the food was horrible!
Read more on http://theforbiddenmeal.com/2015/02/27/california-diary-sanppo-not-worth-your-penny-at-all/
author: Forbidden Meal ..

description: Great food - rude employees I won't be returning. Very unprofessional to talk bad about a customer when they are in earshot.
author: Dallas M.

description: Diamond in the rough, love this place. The spicy tuna is off the hook! Absolutely happy I was able to enjoy a delicious sushi dinner with my husband.
author: Megan L.

description:
I was a little wary to try this place after seeing the reviews on yelp, but after a day of shopping, we were hungry and tired. It was located right across the street from the Japantown mall, so we settled to test it out against the odds and hope for the best. 

And it was false hope. Best word to describe the food was....meh. It didn't really impress, but it didn't stand out in a bad way either. I thought the prices were a bit high for the quantity and quality of the food they served; most dishes they served for dinner was at or above 10 dollars, even the bento special (two dishes with miso soup, salad, and rice) at $9.95. I ordered the bento special, pork Gyoza and the grilled salmon roll, and the first thought that came to mind when my order came was how small the portions were. There were maybe 5 rolls of the grilled salmon that just seemed like mashed up fish from a can and only four bitesize pieces of Gyoza, which me and my boyfriend finished in less than a minute. By the end of the meal, I was still hungry and resorted to drinking the free water to fill me up. 

I would have to say that the service was pretty good though; the servers were prompt with anything we told them to do, and since I came with group of 13, they split checks for each of us. We left the place mildly satisfied, but next time I'm in Japantown, I'll make sure to hit up Yelp and be wiser about making restaurant choices!
author: Kristi L.

description: DONT EVER EVER EVER COME HERE. EVER. IN YOUR LIFE. EVER.I CANNOT BELIVE THIS PLACE IS STILL OPEN!!! Terrible service. Asked for a larger tip. Come here if you hate good dinners. Came to the table once to deliver the food. It was like she was lost it took so long to come to the table. The place is small. Underneath a noisy bar. Terrible parking. Over priced. Bad tasting. Rude and dirty. I mean really?! Lol.
author: Matt G.

description:
It's unfortunate that a restaurant with such delicious food has such terrible service. I took it into consideration that we may have came at a busy time, but it does not excuse the attitude of one of the servers- the older lady with short hair.

We ordered shrimp tempura APPETIZER, two sushi rolls, and two donburi dishes. I ordered the katsu don, which came out last...after about 45 minutes. By the time I got my food, the three other people I was with already finished eating their food. One of the rolls we ordered was the lion king roll. I've had better.

The only thing they were quick about was taking our money. They never once checked up on us to see how we were doing or to even update us on our order. Two gentlemen seated waaaaay after us (about 35 minutes of waiting for our order at this point) and they got their food before me! How was that even possible?! They're lucky my boyfriend paid AND tipped them cause they wouldn't have gotten a dime from me. I'd gone here once before about 5 years ago, and this experience just made me remember why I never went back.
author: Gayle L.

description:
What can I say about this place? Their food is delicious, service is definitely on point and waitresses are absolutely amazing.

I took my sister and kiddies here to check out their menu, YES first meal of the day and we were going to make it a memorable one too. It definitely became a memorable one; for one I had both my sons, secondly, both boys decided to start flipping out before we even ordered and third, our waitress helped me calm them down with free miso soup with rice and stickers. *Winning*

I ended up being able to finally make an order, the bento box combo of Mackeral Teriyaki, Salmon Teriyaki and also came with rice, miso soup and salad. *How I wish the Mackeral was bigger, it had a lightly salted, crispy texture with oh so delicious BBQ like fishy taste on the inside. The Salmon Teriyaki was sweet on the outside and soft and fishy on the inside. Another dish to try would also be the Chicken Katsu Curry!! OMB was this plate heaven. You have curry cooked with carrots and beef, poured atop plain white rice and fresh chicken katsu layed atop of that. The combonation of chicken katsu and curry was definitely the BEST by far. 

My kudos to everyone that helped make our brunch a fantastic one and a big THANK YOU to our fabolous waitress who made it possible for me to have a pleasant meal :)
author: Anonymous P.

description: Just an average japanese restaurant in Japan Town... The bento box for lunch was a good deal and decently priced, so I would recommend getting that.
author: Jessica X.

description:
When i came there, it was empty like a ghost town minus the waitress.

Had to waive down the waitress to let her know i was ready to order.
Service was slow and some of the staff seem lazy.

Food came out in a decent time for it being empty. I ordered a bento combo and seaweed salad. The Seaweed salad was around 5 dollars and came in the portion of a small tea cup. I was quite shocked.

Bento came out luke warm for the chicken and rice. Chicken tasted like it was reheated. A rubbery and dry taste from the chicken.

Waitress never refilled water or even ask. Too busy talking to other coworkers then service.

sashimi there was decent.



Didn't like there service or food, so i decided to leave a 0 tip. No service, and bad food. They got very mad at me for it. I would of gave this spot a 2 out of 5 before then.

I spent about 21 dollars for a bento box and seaweed salad. I should of just went somewhere else. Waste of money.
author: Ron N.

description: Terrible service. People who were sat  after me we're getting their food before me. It also took them 20 minutes to come and tell me that they were out of what I ordered. The hamachi nigiri was the only thing I actually got before I decided to leave, and it was fresh.
author: Kaylyn B.

description:
The food doesnt taste like anything. Its not terrible, but its flavorless. Gyoza could be jucier, tonkatsu was thin and oily, miso was like salt water.

 The servers (Korean, not Japanese, though it doesnt really matter) were eating at the next table while working.

Would not return.
author: K M.

description: Food is amazing! Prices are GREAT! Fun time sake bombing! Love this place. Service is quick and easy.
author: Taylor B.

description: I've been to this place more then a handful of times. We make the drive out there (1 hour or so) and we get great tasting sushi.. Hence the only reason we return. But we have yet to receive good service. The most recent times we have been to this place we had odd seating or a inattentive server. Not too sure if we will be returning.....
author: Gabriela O.

description: Food was terrible. Tonkatsu was dry, over cooked and seemed old. Saba Shioyaki was dry. Even the lemon and orange slices were old and dry. Karage was small and the sauce was not Japanese but a spicy sweet Korean like sauce. Yuck
author: Karen S.

description: Worst customer service during lunch time.....this one server was stressing me out omg
author: Anh P.

description: This place was the worst Japanese restuarant that I have been to. I ordered the seafood tempura lover dish, a dragon roll, and a 49er roll. The tempura had fake crab meat form into what appeared to be a shrimp and the vegetables tasted old. The fish in the 49er roll looked gross....pale pink...but was edible. One bite of the Dragon roll and I nearly threw up. The smell....ewwwww....smelled like a wet dirty dog. And finally the check... a self added 18%! What a freaking rip off. I hardly finished the disgusting food that I was given and in addition to a horrible meal....go ahead and add 18% without ever disclosing that beforehand. Do not come here!
author: Jacqueline A.

description:
This is my first yelp review and I want to dedicate it to this restaurant. Never felt strongly enough to write one until today. 

Absolutely horrible, in terms of both food and service. Wish I could give zero stars. Please do not come to this restaurant even if you are really starving for food (as we did) because it will just make you wish you hadn't eaten the food at all.

First of all, the service was extremely slow. For some reason, when I was trying to order something, the waiter kept insisting that it was something else. Then he cut me off after I repeated my order like three more times and not understanding it, and saying he has to go take care of other customers. I can read, and i know what i'm ordering. Besides, what kind of waiter just runs off saying he needs to go help other customers when there's one he hasn't taken care of right in front of him??

The food took a long time to come. I ordered udon, and the noodle is mushy. The soup is bland and the fried tofu was just ugh. My friend ordered katsu and it was soooo dry. 

When the bill came, i found that what i ordered and what they put on the bill are DIFFERENT items, it has extra charge. I went to the waiter asking him to correct it, but instead i accidentally invited this other waitress there into this conversation. The waiter and waitress started having their conversation in Korean and i was left standing there. 

WITHOUT having actually served my food, she told me that the amount is correct and I needed to pay for it. Well of course, I have already finished my food, so there is no argument for me there. To avoid wasting my time further I paid without giving them tips because honestly, they were rude (the waiter never spoke to me in a friendly tone), and now after reading some reviews about how some customers were charged a tip WITHOUT notifying them and also having multiple charges of the same item on their credit cards makes me a little nervous about what they will do to my final amount. 

Anyways, sorry about the length. I really just needed to get this out of my head because I have never encountered a restaurant as horrible as this one. Go in at your own risk, but I would definitely not be going back there unless I need to yell at them for charging me things that I did not write on the receipt and tips they don't deserve.
author: Y L.

description: This restaurant is fucking so bad,the owner is ridiculous, I paid 20% for tips, this restaurant is not traditional Japanese food, it's Chinese shit
author: Fang M.

description: Food was decent but service sucked! Our server expect a tip when they didnt even service us. Just drop our food and thats it, didnt check on us or anything.
