I would understand if you were busy but it was dead! When we were about to walk out and one of the lady stop and said " you didnt leave tip?" Im like what?! N they say ya u need to give $3 for tip. Hey i manage my own restaurant and of course i will tip you if u give me good service! It just totally ruin my day. I would never come back for the price i pay. You can have the $5 that you force me to tip you when you give me a shitty service!
author: Liony H.

description: Food is good  we come for lunch with 4 persons and they change us  18% gravity charge so bad for me and my  friends
author: Mela L.

description: Their large sanppo sashimi platter is perfect for 4-5 people - so delicious and filling!!
author: Sarah L.

description: The food wasn't out of the ordinary but there is a mandatory 13.45% gratuity charge. We paid for our meal and the waiter forgot to add something on it
author: Harmie P.

description: Our sushi roll was good.  They burnt the beef teriyaki.  They didn't have any chicken katsu.  Teriyaki sauce was different.  The garlic chicken was chunks of garlic with heavy oil.  most likely will not be going back.  The service was a little slow.
author: Roslyn A.

description: Amazing sushi! They provide typical sushi but they have a widespread variety of their homemade special. I've tried lots of different sushi and one diverse from the other and it's hard to decide what is best.
author: Lillian D.

description:
I like their beef teriyaki and have come back for it several times. It has a great smoky taste, BUT their service is okay. I felt rushed during my meal and the servers were not very friendly. Not to mention, their health score is 69! The lowest I've seen in San Francisco. In case you haven't checked out the details of the score, here it is:

Sanppo Restaurant
September 9, 2014 -- Routine Inspection

Violations
Improper storage use or identification of toxic substances
Unclean or degraded floors walls or ceilings
Improper storage of equipment utensils or linens
Inadequate and inaccessible handwashing facilities 
High risk vermin infestation 
Contaminated or adulterated food
High risk food holding temperature 

Although I enjoy their beef teriyaki, I will not be coming back due to these violations. I'm not a very picky person about cleanliness, but I draw the line with vermin infestation and contaminated food.
author: E. P.

description: So recently I went here for the first time. I love Japanese food, but have grown tired of the same places I frequent in Japantown. While there for SF Comic Con, my husband, my niece, and I decided to try this place out. Mind you my niece had never been to J-Town so this was her first experience having food there. I really loved the atmosphere as it felt like a hole in the wall ramen house in Japan. The food was reasonably priced and the food was pretty good for the most part. So why the low rating? The service. Let me tell you what happened. After we were initially seated, the woman who was our server brought us water and took our orders. She corrected our pronunciation of the food, which typically wouldn't have bothered me because I know I can't pronounce Japanese words very well, however she was condescending and very rude about it. For about 15-20 minutes after that we waited for our food, drinking our water. All three of us drank the last of our water and were never once offered a refill. We had to flag down the waitress and tell her we wanted more water. She groaned and, we believe, rolled her eyes at us. After we got our water, we ate and finished our food. We all drank through our water again and were not offered refills again. We decided not to ask again out of frustration so we were sucking on the ice. After we got the check we paid cash. We weren't demanding, sure we asked for more water, but that was it. We said "please" and "thank you" and barely got a nod out of her. Because of all of this and the general attitude toward us we decided to let the tip reflect the service.  $2, but we still tipped.  Now mind you, I've left very generous tips for decent and good service, but this was bordering on insulting. As we prepared to leave and are standing to go, the server walks over, picks up the tip, slams it down, and says "That's only 1%, you need to leave more!" First, it surely was not 1%, it was indeed more since our bill wasn't $200. The spectacle she made and the rude, flat out insulting way we were treated convinced me I will never ever return to this establishment. If this restaurant wants to employ someone that treats their customers like this, I refuse to be subjected to it again. I've had excellent world class service at other restaurants in J-Town, and this was certainly not the case here. We were very disappointed, embarrassed, and overall disgusted by how we were treated. I rarely hope or recommend that a company fire an employee, but I may make an exception here.
author: Justin H.

description:
Only place open late n i rather eat at fast food place then this place. Katsu are frozen n so dryyyyyyy.
We ate at 10:30pm n they even forget to cook one order until we are almost finished.
Free meal i won't ever come back this place.
author: Peter L.

description: There sushi is delish but they dont have too many to chose from. They only have 12 different rolls on the menu but there selection of food is very big to choose from. The sushi rolls on the other hand are very big and filling but come with a heavy price. Overall this place is good but is pricy.
author: Lisa S.

description: Sashimi was pretty damn good.  Service was kinda sucky, but often is in Japanese restaurants (they never bring you water! jeez!)  But was happy with my visit, food was good, place was mellow, open late and open on a Monday night when many sushi joints are closed.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
AVOID COMING HERE AT ALL COSTS.  
     
Came here recently with a few friends and was extremely disappointed with the rude, unprofessional, and Korean (yes Korean, not Japanese) staff, constantly glaring at our table, forgetting multiple times what we ordered, and disregarding us when we asked if they could check on our food. We spent more than two hours at the restaurant due to slow service. Ramen noodles were slightly undercooked and very salty. Also, a mandatory 18% gratuity was sneakily added at the end of our receipt. Seriously? You expect us to pay a gratuity when we're not even grateful for your shitty food and even shittier service? There is a Burger King two blocks away that serves just as mediocre food, with better service, and in which you would be better suited spending your time and money.
author: Tony M.

description: Poor quality Japanese food/service! My son and I took a bite of salmon roll and we ended up chewing fishing bone,no help at all from the waitresses, ask for manager they said not here. I really do not recommend this place! 0 star!
author: Danny G.

description: My son, Logan, and I went here one night in search of good cheap food. Wow, were we surprised. We both got Bento boxes that were fantastic. The service was a little slow but totally forgiven by how friendly the staff was. We saw the Ramen bowls and were blown away by how big and delicious they looked. Can't wait to visit the next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Jennifer C.

description: I've only been here for the bento box lunch specials (take-out) so I can't really speak for the sushi like the other reviews but from what I've ordered, the food was excellent. I went with the Chicken Teriyaki + Grilled Salmon combo which I enjoyed very much. I've only been here for take-out but every time I come in i'm welcomed warmly by the staff and even offered water, tea and miso soup. Top notch service and great food for a great price. I recommend coming here for the lunch specials.
author: Chris I.

description:
The draws for me and my family are the service, bento boxes and chirashi.   
 
The waitresses are very friendly and accommodate special dietary requests for the elders  (no added salt or sauce on the side).,  Extra ginger too.

My fave bento:
Saba shioyaki...yum.  perfectly done.
Salmon skin handroll...crispy skin like it should be
Salmon shio or teriyaki...just right

Chirashi...ingredients were fresh.  really good.

Been going to Sanppo for years.   Always satisfied with the experience.
author: RJ A.

description:
That awkward moment when your friend who's a newb foodie totally does stuff you should never do in a restaurant. It's like an art and there are 'no-nos'

I should say I'm not entirely sure how accurate my experience is because my friend very loudly mentioned, "OH what are you doing on yelp? Checking the reviews?" 
-_______- Really?! The waitress can hear you. Anyways, I'm giving 3 stars for the food and +1 for the service. I don't know what's up with all the horrible reviews, it was pretty good to me. I got a Chirashi which I get at every new sushi joint. It was presented nicely and had the most common sashimi: maguro, sake, shiro maguro, hamachi, unagi, and tamago. No tako, sad face. The fish quality was really great, cut rougher like I had in Japan. Maybe according to bay standards this is low, but in Sac it would be top 3 if not best! Delicious. 

Now the sushi rice and tamago are a whole different story. The tamago was hard to eat, I hated the ice cold liquid in between the folds and the graininess of it. Disgusting, it came with two but I could only eat one and painfully according to my friend. I get that like every place is frozen because it's difficult to make but the ones at my jobs are good so try a different brand. The rice was hard and chewy and flavorless. Not sticky and couldn't taste the seasoning. I didn't take the rest to go and I almost never waste so I recommend a change in recipe, it's not that hard. 

The service was really nice, the restaurant was nice to sit in and pretty decent prices. My friend liked her tonkatsu and salmon teriyaki bento but neither of us cared for our salads and it was too difficult to eat anyways because the lettuce wasn't cut small enough. The miso soup was sooo yummy. I liked it but I'd stick with sashimi :P
author: Julia N.

description:
Mediocre everything all around.

The only reason we decided to pop in was because we thought
"Oh, why have we never come here?" - well, now I know.
Miso soup was okay, it had a ton of tofu in it.
Tempura Sashimi combo had Safeway-quality fish.
Salad was sad.. and it's pretty hard to make a side salad sad.
Service was pretty slow and forgettable, 
I'm pretty sure the only time they said something
was when they came to take our order and asked if we were ready.

Overall I probably wouldn't come here again, as there are so many options in this area.
Even the ones I think are pretty bad.. are still better than here.

DUDE WHO WAS SITTING NEXT TO US: If you read this, 
I hope that was your last date with that chick. 
She was bored, boring, and hated all the cool stuff you were into.
You deserve better, def not someone who only knows about bad TV shows.
author: Jade T.

description:
The food was AIIIIGHT! However, the service I had today killed it. I've been here about once or twice before and the service was never this bad. After today... I'M NEVER COMING BACK HERE, MARK MY WORDS!

We orderd the...
Rock n Roll roll: I've had better
49er roll: GOOD!
Dynamite roll: It was a bit heavy and left an oily after taste.
Edamame: NOT fresh
Miso soup: Was just your regular Miso...

After paying, the lady confronted my friend and I and told us the tip that we gave was low. And YES, I said "told" and not asked. I was shocked she even f*ckin' told us to leave a 15% tip when it didn't even state on their receipt that we have to; if she asked us nicely may be I would've left her that 15%  tip. How about being more attentive and stop staring at the window, daydreaming, then wonder why you got that tip. She informed us that all restaurants require that, and I came back at her like "YES, all expensive and fancy restaurants do, HOWEVER unless if its stated on the receipt that I have to leave a 15% - 18% tip.". DAMN, lady just appreciate you got a tip than nothing at all!
author: Johanna M.

description:
Ok... So I've been reading all of the reviews and I might be naive... But I can't imagine why this place has such mediocre reviews.

Well- let me just start by saying that I've only had two things here. I get them every. Single. Time. 

I get an avocado + cucumber roll.
I get vegetarian miso ramen.

The veggie roll is always fresh. Like, amazingly fresh. 

Now, you may think veggie ramen (NO pork broth- miso broth) is easy to come by in SF. But let me tell you! It's not. But this veggie ramen is good. And they offer chicken broth, veggie broth, and pork broth! So many options. I'd say 90% of ramen places don't offer anything but pork broth.

This is my go-to ramen place. Buuuuut I only get those 2 things- so take that as you will.
author: Christina R.

description:
Nope. I've had better and for a better value too.

My mom and I ordered 2 rolls - both were disappointing. They added way too much water, which makes it easier to roll the sushi and have it stay together, but results in mushy sushi. With the crab meat inside and unflavored rice (not sure it was sushi rice), it was just tasteless mush. :(

The dragon roll is different from other sushi places. The avocado on top is replaced by crab meat.
author: Mimi X.

description: This is our go to spot when we visit Japantown. Great bento box specials for lunch. Restaurant is clean. Food is fresh and service is friendly!!
author: lori g.

description: Service could not be worse, food is terrific, . If was not restaurateur open now nearby Hotel Kabubi, I definitely not try this sushi restaurant
author: Eric C.

description:
I visited this restaurant with my family and was very impressed. The service was prompt and reliable. Our server for lunch was very friendly. At dinner our server was not very friendly, but still made sure we had everything we needed. 

The pricing was fair especially compared to many other places in the area. The green tea was the best I've ever had, and it was free! The miso soup was phenomenal and the lettuce in the salad was very fresh and crisp. I had the bento box with teriyaki chicken and a grilled salmon roll. The salmon roll was not as good as I expected, however the chicken was great. 

My family and I were so impressed that we came back the same day for dinner. Again the green tea and miso soup were delicious. This time I ate the teriyaki salmon, and a California roll. The salmon fell apart in my mouth and had great flavor. The California roll was also very good. We ordered the chicken yaki-tori as an appetizer and it was delicious.

 I will be recommending this place to all of my friends. I don't like the city, but I will be sad to leave this place behind.
author: Nessa V.

description: I had the gogo. The sushi is fresh and worth the price. Recommend it to anyone who is looking to find a good sushi spot.
author: Stacey N.

description:
Living next to Japantown I've tried various places here. I tried Sanppo for the first time on a whim for dinner with my bf.

-friendly staff, but not attentive (never received water refills, nor dishes removed that piled up)

-bf ordered bento box that seriously came with 6 slivers of chicken teriyaki, no joke it looked like someone ate a portion it was so small what he received!!

-I ordered shabu shabu, took forever, and the meat was in weird chunks... Not slices. Very bland sauce option. Very regrettable choice

-bf ordered lion king roll, it was a very sad lion king :(

-it was COLD the door would be left open by people entering/leaving, and even when the door was closed it was cold!! And just as a reference I was at the very back table way far away from the door.

I will not be coming back here.. For the price I can get a bit better food and better service elsewhere!
author: vanessa g.

description:
Late lunch after seeing Sherlock Holmes at the Kabuki on Christmas Day.

Started with hamachi nigiri and saba nigiri, then on to the katsu curry. The entree came with the standard little salad and miso soup.

The fish was too firm, the mackerel almost seemed cooked. The sushi rice was bland and slightly undercooked.

The curry, however, was excellent, with chunks of carrot, beef, and onion. The cutlet was a bit small but tasty.

Service was just a little too brisk, leaving me feeling more than a little rushed.

I'll return, but not if I want to relax and savor my meal. And I'll definitely avoid the sushi next time.

I'd rather give 2.5 stars, but 2.0 it is.
author: John C.

description:
NO NO NO! This is NOT what good Japanese food tastes like! The food here sucks! The prices suck! 

We just ordered some beers, a plate of sashimi, karaage chicken, and gyoza. The sashimi was just mediocre. The fish didn't seem as fresh as sashimi usually tastes. The karaage chicken was dry, tasteless, and nothing like what I was expecting. The gyoza was disgusting with a slightly sour taste. I could buy frozen gyoza from Ranch 99, cook it myself, and make it taste better than this gyoza tasted. 

I will say their miso soup was good. But that's the only positive thing I can think of and it doesn't balance out all the other crappy food I had. 

Honestly, the prices are high for what you get and the food is terrible. I really would NOT recommend going here!
author: Jacqueline C.

description: I give it 3 stars because the food is quite good, but the service lost them the other 2. Our waitress didn't understand to get a food order from all 3 of us at the table. We had to ask her 3 times to stay put and take ALL of our orders. Food came and the plates stayed throughout the entirety of our visit. Check the photos if you don't know what I mean. We sat for a full 5 minutes with all empty plates at the table. My mom tried to be nice and excuse the waitress because of how "busy the restaurant was and there's only two of them." It wasn't that busy, I promise you. Anyway, we were actually there to celebrate a birthday but I didn't want to add to the bill at the restaurant at that point. The waitress must have read my mind because that check came so fast without us having to ask- no "would you like dessert", no "how was it," no nothin'. My mom asked me how much she should tip. I said to leave a little something acknowledging she did bring us food, but 15% is out of the question. As we left, our waitress looked surprised and confused...I won't be back to explain.
author: Courtney T.

description:
Korean/Japanese.

I have a few Chinese/American friends who are very open mind.
They all are very democratic, believe in American constitution, Human Rights. So, they know what's wrong with Chinese Government. 

They all said that eating shark-fin-soup is should be illegal.

One of them, he is 5th generation Chinese, who doesn't speak Chinese at all, took me here.
When we walked in, there were 4 old Korean men talking something out loud in Korean. Really shouting to each other.
My friend didn't know that was Korean, actually he thought that was Japanese, only because we were in a Japanese restaurant.
Do I know Korean?
No, I don't speak Korean, but I know the sounds of, and difference between Japanese.
The 4 old Korean men seemed really excite for something.
It didn't look like arguing or find something disagree.
It seemed something very exciting.
Maybe they were talking about Korean Pro golfer.
Or, Korean soup-opera.
But, the funny thing was that they stop shouting and even talking to each other when their food came.
The old Korean men were eating so quietly.

I like those old Korean men.
Eating quietly is good etiquette.
Speak minimum at a dining table is good etiquette indeed.

About the 8 dollar Lunch Bento-Box.
Bento-Box is already wrong word such as ATM machine, Shiitake-mushroom.
I got Tonkatsu, Gyoza and Salmon skin hand roll "Bento Box".
SUCKED.
Tonkatsu was so dry like my heel.
Crappy Gyoza and the Salmon skin hand roll was like sucking my big toe.
I was like I go FXXX myself, I mean that you can find a better bento at Uoki, Osaka-ya and Nijiya for sure.

My Chinese friend was happy.
He still thinks this is good Japanese food only because the location, at Japantown. 

Sanppo was Japanese own many years ago but not anymore.

I am OK coming here with my friend when they ask me to join them.
But, I won't be back here for my self.
author: Nobu K.

description:
I read many of the reviews and nobody had the same problem I did.  We dined with a party of four and they included the gratuity.  I am actually able to figure out how much to tip on my own.  The food was very average with tough chicken and soggy (yes soggy) rolls.  Carpet is stained beyond belief for a restaurant.

So food was 2.5 but with the included tip trick, overall rating is a one.  It would be something if they somehow noted their policy but not only is nothing said or written, when the check arrives, the tip portion is blank allowing for the mistake or opportunity for a double tip..however you want to look at it.
author: Greg S.

description: Food wise this spot is not bad actually. My bento box came in a favorable portion that I was able to finish. Sashimi, the part where most pseudo-Japanese restaurants screwed up on, was fresh and pretty delicious if I should say, and perhaps because of the fact that it was really empty when I showed up, service turned out quite well. Even our bill was a pleasure to look at considering San Francisco. Now you might ask why the three star then? If this exact restaurant landed in, let's say Topeka, Kansas or Columbus, Ohio, it will be an instant five-star. The abundance of Japanese restaurants in San Francisco is just so great that this place have nothing that outshines places nearby. I've heard of even better options within steps away from this restaurant. You might want to drop by if you're not in the mood for some daring hip new sushi options but just a plain old Japanese lunch - but make sure it turns out empty, because the less people there are, the more those ladies will concentrate on you!
author: Wayne C.

description: It's open late so they get points for that. Japanese food was okay and nothing special and it wasn't exactly cheap. I'd go back purely for convenience (e.g., if I'm coming home late from work and need a bite)
author: Ross I.

description: I get sushi from here weekly. My favourites are Sakura, Rainbow, and 49ers rolls. I have no complain quality-wise. I would like to pay a little less but what can you do! If the wasabi was more spicy, it'd be all perfect. All-in-all, although not the best sushi I had but good enough for me to be a regular.
author: Milad A.

description:
i left sanppo just about 20 minutes ago.  half-way home, i had to start powerwalking--quickly, yet very carefully--in order to make it home in time to not soil myself. do not eat here. if yelp let me underline phrases, i would underline and bold that last line.

i think it was their salad. a couple of pieces of lettuce looked sketchy, but i ate it anyway bc i'm stupid like that and because i like to think that i have an iron stomach. the worst part of this experience though was my fiancee's unmerciless mocking during the interminable journey back to my toliet (thanks, heather).
author: DW S.

description:
I've eaten here three times and each time the fish in my sushi wasn't fresh and the rice was hard. I've also tried their udon and tempura and both were tasty. Their prices are a little high for the quality of food you get. Their presentation could use improvement, as my rolls come out basically thrown haphazardly onto a regular old white porcelain plate. There is no sushi bar and all their sushi is made "behind the scenes" which I found odd for a sushi restaurant. 

All in all, while my fish and rice weren't great every time I've eaten here, my food still tasted alright and I was fairly satisfied with my meals. I'd recommend not getting sushi and stick with the rest of the menu.
author: Emily D.

description:
Do not trust someone that is not into their food. I let my cousin pick this place. 

The food wasn't the worst thing in the world, it was edible. But then so I Mc Donald's. Wait I shouldn't compare this to Mc D's, that was be insulting Mc D's and I like Mc D's. Why was this place chosen out of every other place in Japan town? Urgh. When I spend money on food I like to at least have enjoyed it. 

Got some sort of Sushi as a starter... It was forgettable. I think I could compare it to the prepackaged sushi you get at a supermarket. YAWN!

I ordered the Beef Curry. I am always sceptical when ordering a Japanese style curry. My mum worked then managed a Japanese restaurant years ago, so when I was 9 I was eating Japanese food (hence my lack lustre mood for wanting to spend money on it - UNLESS it is out of this world like Dinings).  For one my rice was swimming in the sauce. The ratio of rice to sauce was ridiculous, should have been a soup. They should also reconsider calling it a beef dish with the amount of beef given. Should have said it was garnished with beef. 

Underwhelming service... Probably because they know it's not that great so are not bothered. I only ate the food because I was so hungry. I would have preferred to starve myself and save myself the money. Places like this put me off spending money on Japanese food.

I would have preferred to not give it any stars.
author: Enid S.

description: I came here because a nearby store owner recommended the bento lunch special. It seems like a good deal at $8.50, but despite what others say, the portion was not huge. It was very small.  The chicken teriyaki had a terrible burnt taste and the tonkatsu was still pink in the middle. I waited for about 10 minutes and until it turned brown. I do not recommend this place at all. If you were wondering, it is run by Koreans.
author: Nancy M.

description: I understand this isn't supposed to be the best tasting or fanciest restaurant.  However this is by no means a good place to eat at.  The food was overall pretty mediocre, the prices even though relatively cheap still seemed overpriced, but I can't say I didn't enjoy the sushi. The floor smelled like cheap hotel, and the service was pretty bad.  I hate to be harsh but this is a poorly run place.
author: Zachary C.

description:
Through Yelp I heard about the 1st annual soy and tofu festival going on in Japantown...which was pretty small and in need of more work/excitement.  anyways, we walked around afterwards and stopped here for lunch after I had heard about their good bento box deals.  4 out of the 6 of us ordered the bento box, each with different items for around $8 a box (comes with miso soup... nom nom!).  

Bento box items tried: 
-1. The teriyaki salmon was soooo delicious and tender.  However, my piece of salmon wasn't even half of the size of my friend's piece of salmon.
-2. The saba (mackerel) I got was super dry and shriveled up...but I managed to scrape the middle portion of it to salvage and eat up.
-3. the california roll is great...but how can you ever go wrong with that?

Vegetable tempura lunch item:
-yummy!! They give you lots of tempura plus you get miso soup, salad, and rice with it.

Overall, this place was ehh and the server wasn't very friendly and didn't really talk to us or attempt to make any sort of friendly conversation with any of us.  The price you pay for the food isn't worth it, and I'd definitely not recommend coming here.
author: Liz W.

description: Above average price for the bento boxes, and the food isn't the best in San Francisco, but, it is tolerable. Nothing special about it. The staff weren't exactly the best either, but I will give them the benefit of the doubt that they were probably stressed out given that my friends and I came here in April for the Cherry Blossom Festival. The bento box I ordered is a fish type, which tasted bland but I can tolerate the rest of the bento. It's a small, crowded place, with below average service, but a decent enough food selection which is mostly rolls. I'll only come back when other restaurants in Japantown are full.
author: Vincent V.

description:
BAD. allll wrong. good japanese food is not supposed to taste like this..!!!!!
AND the wait took FOREVER!!! sushi didn't even look fresh and the bento doesn't taste good either. STAY AWAY....well unless you want to know what bad japanese food taste like.
author: Irene C.

description:
Great service, but BAD food. Staff is very friendly which is why they deserve the star! But the food is pretty bad. I ordered the dinner box with salmon, gyoza and tonkatsu. The salad was very old, salmon was tiny, gyoza was microwaved (so inside wasn't cooked all the way) and tonkatsu was overcooked. I know it was only $10, but still.. it should be better. 

My boyfriend ordered 4 rolls, and anything that has raw fish, DONT get it. nothing was fresh.. it looked like the fish was left overnight, or even longer. He had food poisoning when he got home. There are plenty of Japanese restaurants in that area so maybe choosing a different one is a good idea.
author: Cara N.

description: I went there once and ordered ginger beef.  It was excellent, char-broiled, the best beef I'd ever eaten at any Japanese restaurant in San Francisco.  We also ordered fried oysters that were hotter and crispier than any of the ones from the restaurants in the plaza across the street.  My girlfriend ordered yaki soba and thought it was very good.  The meat was really fresh and not overcooked.  We went there because it was open late and all of the plaza restaurants were closed. We don't get going until late and it is hard to find a good restaurant open after ten.  We expected the food to be just ordinary and were really surprised.  It is one of the few places open in Japantown that late. It was a real surprise.  I don't understand the bad reviews.  Maybe they're from those people who go to a Japanese restaurant and complain that the restaurant didn't cook the fish and only gave them a little piece.
author: Paul M.

description:
Two stars.

 Why? The service was good. I'm not gonna lie. This is just basically based on the bill...

WHY are you charging gratuity on a group of 4 people? 

We were too angry to argue with the staff since, even though the service was good, they looked shortstaffed.

'Nough said.
author: Susan Y.

description: Sushi was not fresh, kinda bad considering we were there on a Monday (means they didn't have a good weekend crowd).  Won't be back!!
author: C L.

description: This is one of the few options that is open late night - well sort of late at least. Due to the few choices past 9 or 10, Sanppo does offer a full menu with a few drink options until 12 on some week nights. We have ordered a few different dishes all of which were okay but don't really compare to it's day time competition. The prices are fair and the service was friendly but a bit slow at times. Give them a smile or a slight wave and they will come right over. They were tolerant of loud laughter and larger tables which is always nice! It could definitely be cleaner in the front of house - somewhat dated and unclean.
author: Casey C.

description: The worst over priced sushi I've ever had. It tasted like it was thawed and not fresh at all.  The agedashi tofu was the only thing redeeming about the 60.00 bill for two people.  The sign should have been the lack of people there but I like to give people an chance, so, I still ordered food against my better judgment.  Needless, to say, it is not anywhere I will be coming back for... Ever.
author: Erika S.

description: Great food and service. Lunch deals are worth a look if you are not sure about this place. It's now fancy like the restaurants in the center but they serve a great meal.
author: Don H.

description: Paid 17 dollars for a bowl of soup, and the kitchen forgets the udon that they charge extra for. I guess it's easy for them to get an order wrong when theyre mocking the order in their native tongue blatantly in front of the customer. And no, they did not have the decency to apologize or add hot broth to the now warm soup when I came back to the restaurant. Overall, this place is not competent enough to get a single order right.
author: Ari E.

description: This place is great ! Can't complain. Good rolls, prices are as expected for SF. Prompt service and good sushi. The tempera was fresh and delicious and the fish on the Sakura roll was tasty and fresh as well. Would definitely come back.
author: Ashley C.

description:
I ate here by myself...which i never thought i'd do, but when youre on break for work and is in the area..hey why not.  You get to be on your phone updating yourself on all social networking sites, text, and talk on the phone without being so rude. (well thats if you dont talk to loud)

Was craving some chinese food but the one chinese restaurant i found was OVER-P-R-I-C-E-D..in jtown, not surprising. Was def not the biz but walked past Sannppo sushi and had a sign out (very helpful) that had lunch specials for bento boxes for only $7!! It was decent priced for someone as broke as me.. walked in was greeted and had great service.  Bathroom was decently clean with no odor..rate it a B-. They also had the radio on i couldnt figure out what channel but it was either 9.49, 99.7, or 106.1...so i was singing and giggn in a secret manner where no one could notice me. 

The food was worth the $7 precious dollars. Got the beef, cali rolls, and something salmon sushi roll-like. usual taste, the salad was a bit on the watery side but still good..but they were a bit stingy on the beef too, but its no biggie.  

Overall, i'd probably come back here again because it was decently priced with good service. I walked into the jtown mall and passed by other restaurants serving the same "special" for $8+. PLEASE, it was DEF no "Special".
author: Em C.

description:
Avoid this restaurant completely, if you do not want the following below:

-Unprofessional servers that stares at you constantly and talking in loud Korean voices behind your back, waiting for you to finish your food quick and leave mandatory 18% tip on bad service
-ordering below average overpriced food
-nigiri-zushi have a very disproportional ratio between vinegar-ed rice and sashimi, eg) sashimi slice is way larger than a thumb size rice
-beef udon contain signs of rotten beef, creating an unbearable smell in broth

This restaurant was so bad it made me want to warn everyone that reviews on yelp before actually checking the restaurant out like how I did. If you do ever go to SF Japantown, do try other restaurant instead of this one like I did.

One word describe this restaurant as a whole, mediocre.
author: Lu L.

description:
oh how i wanted to love this place because my partner and i walked here in the rain on christmas day -- what romantic comedy did we just emerge from?

drenched, we wanted hot soup -- udon sounded amazing at the moment we were walking through japantown, so we stopped in here with its large awning exclaiming UDON.

we ordered tempura ramen and udon, both were sadly mediocre. the tempura was heavily battered and fried and the broths of both were bland. they offer such a large menu, perhaps they havent the time to hone in on each dish. we won't be back.
author: Melissa N.

description:
There are soo many selections in Japantown, so me and my friends (visiting SF) just chose one randomly and it just so happened to be here. I was craving some awesome sushi (we are in CALIFORNIA and Japantown!) 

The sushi was soo nasty, in my opinion. The gyoza was good..but I had the Vivian roll and the rice was dry (I don't even know how it stuck together in the roll) the shrimp tempura in the middle was cold and the fish on top did not taste fresh at all.

I don't know bout the food there, but if you do plan to go, don't get sushi.
author: Uyen D.

description:
Reasons to come here:

It is open late while the rest of Japantown is closed. If you want to take advantage of the easy parking late at night, this will be one of the main options.

The service is relatively friendly. It looks like it could be good for groups.

There is a large selection of different types of japanese food. They might be able to get a few of them right, I just haven't figured out what that is yet. I even tried asking the waiter for advice, but he seemed to think I had no idea what the food was as opposed to wondering what dishes are good here.

Reasons not to come here:

The food seemed subpar. Nothing here tasted that good. And since we didn't eat all day, w were hungry. We should have been biased towards liking any food that was put in front of us.

They even messed up a crunchy roll. I haven't been to a place that has messed up a roll that they fry, but apparently there are ways to screw it up: you add a ton more rice than necessary to it and cut it in a way so that the roll falls apart when you pick it up.


TLDR: I think it can be compared to a Denny's with Japanese food. It isn't open 24 hours, but it open later than many other restaurants in the area and it has a very wide selection of (Japanese) food.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Ate here last night w friends and hubby. Have eaten at this restaurant a few times before. 

Service: fab! Always taken care of, water glasses never empty, attentive to being more beer. Love that they are open until 1:30am. We had the hardest time finding a place to eat in J town after 10pm. 

Food: my dynamite and 31 special special rolls were great! Seaweed salad was also tasty. Hubby got gyoza and pork dish which he said were good, could've gone heavier on the ginger. Bff got udon and she said it was a little bland. 

Ambiance: they could do some upgrades. Lose the carpeting. Great location.

Will definitely be back.
author: Clarissa C.

description:
Talk about a terrific find!

Was on vacation visiting from friends in Monterey (from Cleveland) and stayed in Japan town.  The second day that we were in the neighborhood I went into Sanppo for lunch.  Talk about the best ginger dressing of my life!  Every time that we went (about 3, or maybe 4) my boyfriend and I both got different things, not sure what specifically as we have now been back in the chilly Cleveland weather for a day now...  but honestly, the sushi was great, as well as the bento!  

I don't want to get any slack from you guys telling me I'm from Cleveland, (not really known for it's sushi, or Japanese fare at all...  but we have traveled quite a bit on the west coast, so don't be a hater on my review!)  

This was a great find for us....  Great food, staff was knowledgeable as well as friendly, and it didn't break the bank!   I wish you were still a block away!
author: Becca S.

description: My husband and I experienced the worst service ever.  My husband's salmon had bones with every bite. No manager onsite and the servers did not care.  I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone and will be advising all my friends and family.
author: Joann G.

description:
There's salt and pepper on the table! What kind of Japanese restaurant puts salt and pepper shakers on the table? 

I should have known better. But I was SO hungry! 

The dressing on my hiyashi chuka (they call it zaru chuka :\) was tasteless. The dish has two kinds of that fake fish cake, no pork, and no bamboo shoots! :*( Canned bamboo shoots are so cheap and easy. 

Anyhoo, mediocre food and the waitress' friend came in for a visit and they had a shoe sharing/trying-on session right next to our table. (Kinda gross and I tried not to pay attention.) We got to check out her friend's GUESS shoes that are too small for her but fit our waitress perfectly! Uh...
author: Jacquee P.

description:
got the tempura bento for $10.50. it was very average. was given one piece of tempura shrimp to accompany the tempura vegetables. bento also had salad, miso soup, rice, and choice of dish (for which i picked CA roll), all of which were decent, but not outstanding.
however I had a taste of their gomoku noodle soup, which was delicious. sorta weirdly, I was served by two Korean ladies (occasionally spoke to each other in Korean), who did average-ish too.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Excellent little eatery in the heart of Japantown, San Francisco.
Prices were excellent (~$7+) for good sized portions along with miso soup and complimentary green tea on request.

This establishment could use a bit of aesthetic updating, but I found it quaint and relieving to have actual Japanese people running this Japanese restaurant.

I would highly recommend this place for anyone who likes Japanese food at everyday prices.
author: Mica Z.

description:
Ironic as it may seem, I am always hesitant to eat Sushi in Japantown, 
Today I went there  because it was the closest, and I was starving. Bad Idea, again. 
I looked  to find the Sushi spot with the most people in it, since I didnt have Yelp reviews to help me, (No smart phone)- Sanppo , was the most populated on a rainy grey Friday afternoon,
so by the measure of peeps, I entered.....
Service is very good, two helpful Japanese (or Korean) waitresses.
No sushi Bar, Sushi prepared in a back kitchen area out of sight.....  bad feeling already, Uh, Oh......

Order:
1) Rainbow Roll : Fish is very unfresh, old, small cuts, tasteless. 
rice falling apart- lackluster appearance

2) Red and White Roll:
Shiro and regular Maguro on top a spicy tuna roll, 
This should have been a dynamic  flavor explosion, instead I wound up picking the very small pieces of Maguro off the top and leaving the spicy tuna roll to be tossed.away.. ....
this is one of the worst sushi experiences I have ever had , next to some bad Uni that I almost regurgitated 15 years ago. 
Oh Yeah, when the roll arrived, the pieces were haphazardly arranged in random, not linear, order, scattered half falling down  on the plate. I do not recall ever seeing sushi plated like this. This to me indicates a total attitude of apathy. I wish I had a camera to take a picture. unbelievable

3) Shiro Maguro and Hirame Nigiri
Very small cuts, The Shiro was completely bland and flavorless, not worth even eating, The "Hirame" had a  indescribable flavor and was very tough.
I do not actually think it was Hirame, it did not taste or look anything like it.

4) California Temaki- was weird shape, smallest amount of  crab, (and I mean, miniscule),  I have ever seen , mostly RICE, Uh, Oh....
Bad sign when rolls just don't look like they are supposed to, or have the minimum standard amounts of ingredients that they are supposed to have.
nori is fresh, however...

I do not have bad Sushi experiences very often, maybe once every 2 years.
But this last time has taught me to buy one or two small items first, before plunking down $50.00 at unknown quality restaurants and nightmare level food...
I do not recommend this restaurant for Sushi.
I agree with past reviews about Sanppo being a Denny's or Mcdonalds level Sushi
place.
author: laurie g.

description:
Ordered a lunch bento special. Got some choices that go with the standards and chose beef teriyaki and a salmon maki roll.

The beef was tough and not very tasty anyway. The salmon roll was better, but the salad and rice were just blah. Didn't help that the miso soup was very salty too and came out way earlier than the rest of our food... I'm sure there's much better options in Japantown.
author: Alan W.

description:
A San Francisco favorite! Takeout is excellent and cheap. 
Always a special time and did I mention it was cheap?
author: Paul L.

description:
After spending most visits to restaurants in Japantown inside the buildings, my partner and I ventured to Sanppo since it was open, and had a decent looking menu.

We had some sushi (chef's choice), katsudon, and udon. It came with green tea, and we had some sake.

I was surprised at the quality of the food compared to the prices. It is definitely not cheap, but was within our price range for the evening. The katsudon was cooked really well, and the onions were cooked thoroughly which is not always the case when I get it at restaurants.

My partner had udon, and the broth was surprisingly flavorful.

The sushi is definitely not the best, but it was still tasty and I would order it again. 

Overall, the dinner was quite wonderful- the food was cooked well, the staff were friendly and helpful when we had a question about what was included in the random sushi roulette of chef's choice, and we got to pay a reasonable amount for dinner.

I definitely recommend it..
author: Megan L.

description: Sanppo is one of my favorite japanese restuarants in the city. The service is always friendly and competent, not to mention fast considering its a nice japanese restaurant. The food is delicious and Ive never come across a menu item that I didnt like. The atmosphere is pleasantly casual and comforting unlike the overwhelming options of japanese restaurants inside the mall that basically look and taste the same. The price for food is average and not too overpriced (considering its japanese food). Ive been to this restaurant more than 10 times and have yet to have a less than awesome experience. If I were able, I would give Sanppo more than 5 stars. Definitely check this place out!!
author: Hannah K.

description:
Star for convenience
Sanppo is open late on Tuesday nights when the rest of the Japantown is nearly deserted.  I must have seen a total of 5 people walking on Post, and 12 people inside Sanppo at 10:30pmish.

Star for great location and signage
Where to go for sushi? Well they have a crazy neon sign that helps one pick a sushi serving place from a non sushi serving place.  Easy to find, easy to get to. 

Star for great service
Promptly seated and so polite. Refilled tea at least 5 times and didn't rush us to leave after we were done eating and they started closing up shop

Star for decent sized portioned and yummy cooked rolls
I didn't get any raw fish here, but it's hard to really comment on the sushi.  I shared two special rolls with my friend, one had cooked hamachi and the other has shrimp tempura.  They sure hit the spot.
author: Skye W.

description:
Nothing special.  Kinda pricey for the quality, but portions are generous.  The rolls were very sloppy, but it was the only place open nearby at the time.  

Come here if you're hungry and need something to eat before hitting up the bars nearby.  No need to go out of your way to try this place.

Not terrible, not great, but convenient.
author: Brian H.

description:
As I continue to write reviews, trying different places etc., my perspective on new restaurants begins to adapt to a higher standard. This begins to become very difficult as the bar is constantly being raised. For example, as I have been to many a ramen house, Daikokuya in Los Angeles has set the RR (ramen record). Sanppo just didn't cut it.

My dad and I had just come from a Giants game craving some late night noodles...being 10:30 PM we decided to go to Sanppo. Since it was so late, we and two other people were the only ones in the restaurant. 

We sat down and ordered our food: two bowls of noodles...no problem there. Now as a test, I started the stopwatch on my phone. In my opinion, the amount of time that it takes to get the bowl of noodles to the table should reflect upon the quality that you get. Longer time = Better quality. 

Eight minutes and thirteen seconds later, (an alright time...considering we were the only ones there), we had our bowls sitting in front of us. To be honest, the noodles tasted like instant ramen (mushy and swolen) while I couldn't figure out what was wrong with the broth...something just did not taste right.

Sitting there, we figured out that the waitresses were Korean and the chef was Hispanic. So either our food was either just plain bad...or a crappy interpretation of Japanese cuisine...

What else...we had to ask twice for water...which shouldn't have to happen when you are the only patrons in the restaurant. But I guess sometimes it is better to watch the news on TV, talk to the chefs and ignore the customers until bill + tip time comes. 

Although Sanppo serves other things besides ramen, they definitely deserves the lonely star...because meh....I've experienced A LOT better.
author: Tyler S.

description:
With so many places in Japan Town to eat, we decided to eat here.

The places in the Japan Town plaza mall or however you call it, were all packed. This was just across the street, and did not want to deal with big crowds and a wait.

The place had a very nice location and easily seen. Surprised it was not packed as the other places on a Friday night. Perhaps that was a sign for things to come, but I like to give things the benefit of the doubt. It was nice that they had the menu posted right outside the restaurant. I was always embarassed to go inside ask for a menu, take a look at it and walk out. So this saves face for both the diner and the dinee. 

The thing that really sealed the deal was the dinner special. It was pick any 3 items for $9.50. The choices included, chicken, beef, tonkatsu, salmon, california roll, and a few other selections. I was like whoa, for a Japanese restaurant in SF, in Japan town, at dinner time, that was surely a great price.

So as we enter, I was surprised to not be greeted by the usual greeter. You actually have to walk a few feet down until and we were finally greeted. I was not sure if we just helped yourself to a seat or what, so it was a bit uneasy just wandering on in.

So I order my dinner special, and picked the california roll, beef and chicken terrayaki. Mind you this also comes with miso soup, salad, and rice. 

The miso soup was ok. When I say ok, I mean it's just like all the other places that serve miso soup on the side. My girl got the Nabeyaki Udon. It actually came before my entree. It was served in a cool looking pot with a handle. So good job with the presentation. I actually had some of it and it was good.

So my food arrives, and I was expecting very small portions, but they were actually decent. It came with 3 (or was it 4) pieces of california roll. The beef and chicken was of a decent portion. The rice was good, no complaints here, and more than enough if I had gotten another choice that required eating with rice instead of the california roll. The chicken was good, and on par with places that cost much more than this place. The beef was alright. I've had better. It didn't seem as fresh as the chicken, and even the sauce could not cover that up. It was passable though. The california rolls were gooood. Above average compared to the ones I've tried from other places. 

I did not give it 5 stars because the service could have been better. Overall a good place to go if you are in the area and are looking to save some money.
author: Eugene N.

description:
I wrote this review too soon :(.

I went again on Tuesday (1/5/10) and was so disappointed. The food is good but this time, my friend's food had hair in it, and the woman claimed it was his own hair. Didn't comp our meal or say sorry.

We asked the waitress to take the food back, and the owner (a woman) came back with the tray and placed it in front of him, took the hair out and showed it to him and said it was his and started pointing at him and telling him to eat the food.

It was so disrespectful. I was extremely disappointed in this. I tried talking to the woman, but she was not hearing it. 

Not to mention, there was a customer there who kept trying to interfere in our conversation and was also saying disrespectful things and no one said anything to him (but I can't blame the restaurant for that). 

Sigh, this was my go to place for veggie tempura. Must find a new one!
author: Parijat T.

description: I liked it! I thought the chirashi bowl was very fresh, the California rolls were above average (with very fresh avocado), the miso was tasty, and the service was just fast enough. I'd go back.
author: Jason G.

description:
Where to start?

Both food and service were abysmal.
Different waitresses did the following: Pour soup over my boyfriend, get our tempura order wrong, give our California Roll to another table - and charge us for all the above. (Including missing California Roll.)

The tempura tasted of old oil, was soggy, and had pieces of old fish in it that we hadnt ordered. Gross gross gross.
And they charged extra for the old fish pieces that we told them we hadn't ordered.

Sushi rolls tasted fishy and looked like they were thrown together by a five year old having a temper tantrum.

The miso was super salty.

The pork was amazingly soggy *and* dry at the same time, and also tasted of old oil.

For some reason even the ginger was limp and unsavory, and didn't manage to clear the horrible taste in my mouth.

The pork in the gyoza was borderline rancid, I kid you not.

This was all bad.  ALL BAD.

The one obligatory star is for not getting food poisoning. Amazingly enough.
author: Kat B.

description:
I used to eat here a lot when I was still a student at USF because they were the only ones open after I end class at 10 PM. Because I ate frequently, I've made good friends with the servers who make sure I receive excellent service each time I come. My favorite stuff to order is the 49er's roll, the 3-item bento box, and the Ten Zaru Soba. All of them are pretty good. 

I was a little disappointed though when they raised prices recently. I wish they kept the prices like it used to be.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Disappointed...It has been at least five years since I had a meal here.  I think owners changed.  I was only aware when the language the owner spoke was not Japanese.

My brother ordered futomaki, but tekka maki arrived.  As I was about to wave down the waitress about the mistake the couple we shared the table with asked if it was theirs... It was.  I passed to them assuring them that we had not touched it.  My bento lunch was tonkatasu and saba shioyaki.  Miso soup, iceberg salad, pickled bean sprouts and seaweed salad rounded out the meal. Very small portions but only $6.95.  

The pictures of the bentos are misleading.  I suspect the cut in portions was to reduce prices.

I won't be returning.
author: Christine L.

description: This place was just fine. We came during the Cherry Blossom Festival because the food booths were too packed. The tables were filled inside, but we were seated right away. I ordered the seafood udon, and it was good (there were regular udon noodles and also glass noodles), but there were some random seafood items that I couldn't identify, so I just took those out. The sushi rolls were good. I also got miso soup and salad with mine.
author: Sara W.

description: Pass this one by. Below average sushi and drab interior.
author: Rob N.

description:
After walking in and not seeing a sushi bar in the restaurant, I should have walked out.  I like being able to see my sushi prepared and seeing that the fish is fresh.  However, it was a Saturday night and my boyfriend and I decided to give it a chance since its close to our house.  

We ordered a Sapporo and were brought out a different beer.  No problem, the other beer was still really good.  We were not given any complimenatry tea, so this dropped their service rating down a notch.

Within a minute of ordering our rolls and nigiri, they were out on our table.  I am not one to complain about diligent service, but there is such a thing as too quick - it made me question the freshness of the place.  The sushi looked fine and we ate it.

...A few hours later, I was paying for it.  Either the sushi was bad, or they cross contaminated it with shellfish, which I am allergic too.  I only have reactions if I actually consume shellfish, and that is why I have been fine at other sushi places for years because they are clean and segregate the fish. 

Needless to say, I wouldnt return here again.
author: Dana B.

description:
Well I don't think I'll be returning here... there are so many better places in this city.

The sushi itself was just okay.  
Prices were reasonable.
Service was awful!  I sat without water for my entire meal, and I even asked 2 of the 3 servers for a refill (one server I asked twice) and they both never came back with water.  I was so thirsty.  Just poor service all the way around.
author: Sandy M.

description:
Cheap sushi is an oxymoron; either that or it tastes like shit and leaves you sitting on the porcelain throne the next day. At least, that's what I thought until I stumbled upon Sanppo. A very unassuming place staffed by only two employees, the woman handles the waitressing while the other makes the food.

The crown jewel of Sanppo is the hamachi sashimi. At $9 for thick fresh slices, this is by far the best deal in town. Each slice consisted of magnificent whitish fish with a stunning rose colored tip. These were served at the perfect temperature to maximize their sweet, milky and buttery flavors. They literally melted in your mouth. Waitress, keep these coming please! I had the Lionking roll too; pretty zesty! 

4 stars, -1 for the ugly bathroom.
author: Jan P.

description: Dinner bento with three items of your choice for like $10 comes with miso soup and salad. Looks better on the menu than it does when it comes out. Portion is rather scanty. You see more of the bottom of the bento box than you see food. Whether you get teriyaki chicken, beef, or salmon, they all come with the same oversweetened teriyaki sauce. I highly do NOT recommend the salmon skin handroll as it is soggy and tastes like old grease. Food is between mediocre to subpar. I'm no sushi expert but their sushi rice is dry and almost like Vietnamese broken rice and too sweet.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Yes, it's a Japanese restaurant owned by Koreans, but it's: 

1. Open late
2. Inexpensive
3. I didn't get sick

Therefore, it's better than any other late-night places, eh hem, Denny's.
author: Angellica Y.

description:
Good basic sushi place that's very conveniently located a block or so from the Sundance Kabuki movie theater. Convenient, too, is the fact that the place is open till about midnight every night. Hence, Sanppo has become my go-to place for the "dinner" part of "dinner-and-a-movie" at the Kabuki.

The service is casual and friendly, and the sushi is surprisingly good and reasonably priced, and the place is typically not crowded. A very good choice for that late-night movie post-mortem...
author: donal c.

description: Best Sushi I've found yet... I live up in Santa Rosa (about an hour north) and my husband and I make a trip down to Japan Center for both our birthday's each year to enjoy this place.
author: Kela M.

description: When you want to eat sushi, perhaps the first consideration isn't whether they have a TV and are showing the baseball game. Unfortunately, that was our basis for choosing this place. The Dodgers lost. But then so did we.
author: Will R.

description: I would rate this restuarant  0, food is soso the point is  wrost services ever the service bell is not working and no one care about the customer besides talking gossip at the back. I called the service for five mins no one help me.  I have to get my own chopsticks ...bad experience ever
author: MC M.

description:
Edmund says "Decent" and i concur. We had a group of 7 after the Taiko concerts during the cherry blossom festival on Saturday, which was over at 1pm. Sanppo is the closest restaurant to the Pagoda so as you'd imagine there was a line. Luckily, they had it together and were running people through without making them feel like they were being rushed. 

The food (which is what we're talking about...) was good. I tried a sashimi bento box, 2 rolls (rainbow and spicy tuna), miso, edamame, and tempura. So i had a pretty good feel for everything on the menu. Everything was good, everyone was happily filled, and warm, felt good, and satiated. Bill for seven was a cool $150 with 6 bento boxes, 4 big beers, 4 apps, 2 designer rolls, plus $25 tip. A-OK.
author: Adam X.

description:
Ack! The horror!

I remember coming here years ago, with either my father or gf at the time. They had good/fresh fish.

Few days ago I was with my grandparents and a visitor from a different country and MAN! were we disappointed.

The sashimi was sticky and fishy, the service was moderate at best. All the food was just ok if not below that. I felt embarassed bringing my relative from a different country here and it ruined my grandfather's afternoon.

Sanppo is a NO NO. Try the other amazing sushi places around Japantown, but skip this place and save yourself the heart and belly ache.
author: Tip S.

description: I feel kind of bad to leave a bad review because me and my Dad know the owners pretty well and they are good people, But The new 3 female korean workers are so rude and need to be fired! One gave me a nasty snobby look because she didn't understand me? Please if you come to America learn the damn language or atleast be nice you are working in a damn restaurant where service means something.
author: Daniel L.

description:
"Decent" is hella the word to describe this place. Sanppo is one of those Japanese joints you go to when you don't feel like spending too much money, and don't mind having sushi that isn't made with the Hamachi of the gods. The food is not bad at all, nothing special, but it does the job. The prices are great, especially for the sushi rolls which are huge and don't suck.

Only complaint I have for now is that the service was a bit slow. It took them twice the time to prepare my one sushi roll than it did to make two bento boxes. Other than this, however, I really don't have any gripes with this place, and I would definitely come back if I had a late night sushi/Japanese craving.

Yelp, make me elite!
author: Edmund C.

description:
So I didn't realize how many restaurants are not open on Thanksgiving.  Especially for lunch.  A and I were trying to look for a place to have lunch on Thanksgiving day and drove around the Sunset, the Richmond, and finally decided to go to Japantown because we were sure the restaurants there would be open.

We were wrong.

So wrong.

When we saw Sanppo with their doors wide open, it was like a beacon of light shining through the thick fog.  What?  A restaurant that's open?!  WE.  MUST.  EAT.

So we went in, got seated, and ordered.  I think we ordered a bowl of udon to share and a couple of rolls.  Nothing spectacular, but it definitely did what it had to do.  It was decent and it filled my very hungry rumbly tummy.

Two yums up for being open on Thanksgiving when K&A were looking for a place to eat!
author: Kris L.

description:
It was a late Friday night, done working a show and you're in Japantown and you're starved. Unfortunately there are not that many options after 10:30pm. Alas, see the sign that Sanppo is open until 1:00am and SCORE, you go in. 

I do not recommend their sushi, the rolls were fine but the fish itself was rubbery and the most god awful disgusting thing I have EVER had.  I couldnt even finish it, had to roll it up in a napkin and hide it.

Decided it was best to stick with the cooked items. Got a combo tempura platter that we shared and they gave us two porttions for the price of one. Tempura was fine as was the miso soup. 

Resonably priced, odd service and thought it was a stranger touch that they were showing the Food Network in their dining room. Like why show people BETTER options to eat on TV than what is in front of your face right now?

Needless to say, I won't be back. Just blech.
author: ruth n.

description: I decided to give this place a re-visit last night after not coming here for a long time.  It turned out to be a regrettable decision.  I should've figured there's a reason why I haven't come back for so long even though I go to Japantown regularly.  The sashimi combination overall was pretty bad, tastes not fresh (with the very small possible exception of the hamachi).  The spicy hamachi roll I didn't care for (for one thing, it was done futomaki-style which is not my preference).  The one thing that secured them a one-star rating was the service.  The lady server looked bored standing around most of the evening.  Then, halfway thru dinner I wanted a refill of water.  The few times that girl walked by I'm sure she noticed my glass was empty.  She made no offer or gestures towards refilling the glass.  She only refilled it when I asked for it when she brought the check, and even then she gave a disinterested response.  Terrible staff member there. In fact, I gave a tip that was barely over 10 percent and thought about giving even less, but I did write a note on the slip I signed to tell them what I thought of the service.
author: H K.

description:
So while Wekfest is going on we had find a place to watch the Canada/USA hockey game, so we started to think of sushi bars. We look across the street and thought lets try here. When I walk into Sanppo I see the tv and ask the host if we could watch the hockey game. They said yes and changed it. They sat us in the back and we could not see it, so in the end they let us sit at the table where the staff normally puts food and where they sit.   That right there was a huge plus.

Then it came time for the sushi. At first we were just going to eat light, but since they were so accomidating we order a lot of sushi and drinks. Beer, sake and sushi, good friends and good hockey what better?  The sushi was portioned well and the fish just melted in our mouths. I was surprised at how good it was and would come back here anytime I'm back in Japantown. I've at all the Japanese sushi places in the mall and I'll go here first.
author: Chris G.

description:
This place is borderline between two and three stars, but in the end leaned toward the lower of the two in our opinion.

We went here during the Cherry Blossom Festival, so probably didn't get the best of impressions of the place due to the huge crowds. The service, for how packed the place was, was decent but nothing to praise.

The food itself was pretty forgettable, sadly. We ordered and shared a bento box, and were pretty underwhelmed by all of the food included. It wasn't bad, but it lacked the flavor we had hoped would greet our mouths with each bite. 

Overall, not bad but lacking qualities that we would associate with a "good" place too. The only true positive was that the place was very cheap for our lunch eating needs, not sure if the same could be said of dinner. Regardless, we don't have any intention of going back here again.
author: Sami R.

description: Went here for lunch with friends. I ordered the bento box: tonkatsu, gyoza, saba, which came with rice, salad, and miso soup for around $8! So affordable! The tonkatsu was juicy and flavorful. Saba was grilled to perfection. Staff was super friendly and place is clean. Would love to come back here soon.
author: Angel S.

description:
Today, I ordered the Lunch Special Sushi #2 with a California roll (don't hate me, but I prefer this to spicy and regular tuna rolls) and 5 pieces of nigiri.  It comes with miso soup and salad.  

Their miso soup was really salty.  Normally, I finish my soup, but this time I just couldn't do it.  Their salad has iceberg lettuce, a tiny bit of shredded carrot and purple cabbage with a mayo-based dressing.  I didn't like it.  After waiting about 15 minutes or so after the soup and salad, I got my lunch.

The California roll looked and tasted delicious!  The rice was fresh, there was an abundance of avocado, and the crab meat filling was so creamy and yummy. There was also a nice seaweed salad on the side.  The nigiri was just alright.  They served the usual suspects: salmon, tuna, shrimp, a whitefish and something else.  I was disappointed in the quality of the fish - the whitefish seemed like it was probably previously frozen because it tasted watery.  I like to eat the salmon last because it's my favorite.  But this time, there was something about it that wasn't right AND, I nearly choked on the membrane that holds the flesh on the fish.  They should've taken it off before serving it.

Anyhoo, they get 3 stars because it's cheap for Japanese food and their California rolls were great.
author: vira k.

description: I went to this place on Sakura festival day. I ordered California something salad. I'm sorry I forget the name. But, as the name tellls, this salad was like " California" cause it used a lot of Avocado. Also, there is no lettece instead I can say this is Tofu salad. That was Yummy! It is totally different from common salad in US. It was typical Salad in Japanese Bar restaurant!! Yummy:-) Moreover, Sushi my friends ordered was also tasting nice and looking nice!!
author: Kozy T.

description:
Why I let people convince me the best sushi is in Japantown is beyond me.....I mean really?
The people are sweet, the service is slow, the sushi is....well...as good as mall sushi....They do have some rather large looking soups that might be good....but the "seafood" one had maybe 3 shrimp in it...and then noodles.....
Definitely not coming back.....
author: Bianca L.

description: Ramen Dojo is better....Not bad, but not as good as I expected it would be
author: Eric A.

description: Only happened to try this place out because of the long wait at Ssisso. Mediocre sushi, TERRIBLE customer service.  I'm not the type to complain but my friend and I had to ask for spoons for our miso. And then ask for water for the table. We were maybe about one of the three parties there. The waitresses also clearly looked bored and inattentive. There are tons of Japanese restaurants in San Francisco. My friend and I will not be returning!
author: Monica S.

description: Bad service. Waited 35+ minutes for food with little acknowledgement from the servers. We eventually left without eating.
author: Kate T.

description:
I don't really know how to rate this place...

I didn't come here for sushi. I came here for some soba. I've been having a WICKED soba craving lately. What does it mean when you crave soba noodles? Am I buckwheat-deficient or something? 

Anyway... So, the zaru soba was fine. I wanted the cold sauce to be saltier, but maybe I'm just a salt fiend. I actually dumped soy sauce in it. I ordered some hamachi, too, which was also okay. But the man ordered sushi for his meal: a couple rolls. Which has lead me to ponder...

WHAT HAVE WE DONE TO SUSHI IN AMERICA?

Jesus, those were some HUGE rolls. With all kinds of stuff in them. I mean, he gave me a couple pieces and I could HARDLY GET THEM IN MY MOUTH. It's almost embarrassing to eat sushi like that. No, it IS embarrassing to eat sushi like that. I felt like I had to cover my mouth while I shoveled it in... It's not that it doesn't TASTE good, but it's not what sushi is supposed to be...

Maybe it's just me, but I'm kind of a sushi purist. I prefer nigiri and sashimi or if I'm feeling fancy, chirashi. I like to taste the fish, rather than batter and sauces and vegetables. and I like to taste it all in a single bite -- that's the premise, right? Sushi is supposed to be a MOUTHFUL? At least, those are the tenets my Japanese friends preached while they ushered me across Honshu on a grand eating tour. 

Instead, here in America, we have McDonald's-style sushi. SUPER-SIZED sushi. With ALL KINDS of stuff in it, fried, and slathered in mayonnaise... Ugh. 

If you like that, they have really good McDonald's-style sushi at Sanppo. And pretty decent soba.

Okay. I'm over it.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Sushi, in Japantown? I know, a shocker.

While not the best sushi I've had in my lifetime, Sanppo restaurant is not a place to be slighted. The food is very good and the portions are large. My compatriot was surprised by the size of the dinner box put in front of her, and for only $10. Being able to mix a small sushi plate with teriyaki beef and tempura without breaking the bank made me a very happy boy. And it was all quite tasty.

You can eat quite well here and for not a lot of scratch, which is always of high regard in my book. Throw in their fast and exceedingly friendly service and you find a place I'm more than happy to come back to at my next trip to Japantown.
author: Keith M.

description:
Several months ago, my girlfriend and I embarked on a campaign to not repeat at any restaurant.  Why?  With so many great restaurants in the city, we would never be able to visit them all if we fell into a rut at any one restaurant.  We first went to Sanppo months ago as part of that campaign.  I loved it.  Really loved it.  Ever since that first visit, whenever we decided to go for sushi, I would simply say..."Sanppo?"  

On Sunday night, we got back from a four day trip to Austin, TX and decided that after all that BBQ, sushi was in order.  I responded with my one word request, "Sanppo?".  My girlfriend relented.  I thanked her.

They have an abundance of special rolls.  Probably more special rolls than normal nigiri or maki rolls.  The Lion King is superlative.  It is smothered in a warm sauce that really makes it.  The Red and White roll is a tuna lover's dream as well.  True sushi aficionados will probably look down their noses at Sanppo, but I like it.
author: Chris I.

description:
I just got off the phone with my credit card company, disputing a charge from Sanppo. I ate there one time two months ago, and a charge for the same  amount reappeared on my card yesterday. I don't want this to happen again, so I probably won't return.

When I did eat there with friends, we just got some maki sushi, and it was ok.
author: Aiko R.

description: Fresh sushi, quick & attentive service! Perfect spot to stop at before or after a movie at the Kabuki! The customers were pouring in after 9:30pm... it's always a good sign when there is not an open seat in the house.
author: Amy J.

description:
My husband was jonesing for good ol' Japanese rice.
This guy's gotta have his rice no matter what.  
So off to Japan Center we went.

We were looking for something close to downhome typical Japanese food.  Something like Taihei, Usui, or Naomi's back here at home.

He thought the restaurants in the Japan Center were "too cutesy", so we asked around & someone recommended going across Post St. to check out the eateries there.  Sanppo looked like it would fit the bill.  

Lunch bentos ran around $7.  Choice of three items served alongside miso soup, salad, rice, tsukemono.  My husband ordered California roll sushi, teriyaki beef, & tonkatsu.  With the exception of the tonkatsu, he really enjoyed his meal.  
 
I ordered tempura udon.  $7  The noodles, wakame, & broth were soothing.  The tempura .......just okay.  Not as light & feathery as I like.   Bit too oily also.  I ended up eating just a few of the veggie pieces & giving the rest to my husband.  

You would think that the described food would have been enough to satisfy my hubby's appetite, but nooooo.  He ended up buying eight more pieces of roll sushi to munch on while we further explored the city.

Service was good, inside decor was nice.  It was good enough to satisfy hubby's rice addiction until we got back home.
author: Lynette T.

description:
It's fuckin' good, dammit! And it's fuckin' cheap! What more do you people need to KNOW, for chrissakes. 

It's good sushi. It ain't overpriced. It's easy on the wallet, it's easy to find, the serving staff are polite, and the miso soup rules, goddammit. Plus they do something with the rice...the rice is some damned fine rice. Just plain white rice! And I love it! And I'm about as far away from being a goddamn monk as you can. 

The only reason it's not five stars is, it closes a bit early for my tastes. I mean, what if I get a four o'clock craving for a spider roll? What am I supposed to do? Get a tommy gun and hold up some poor sushi chef in the middle of the night? Preposterous. Plus, sushi under pressure just seems bad. Sushi is an art form. A delicious art form. 

Plus, sake bombs. Who can turn that shit down. Suddenly your trip into Japantown changes from a "trip" and into a "rampage", and it's awesome. Fuckin' awesome. 

Were this one of my typical reviews I'd use a bunch of ridiculous metaphors and compare it to old movies and video games and genitals and animals and shit, but really, why bother? Good sushi. Get some. Have some. Be on it. Now.
author: Daniel V.

description: The food here is pretty average for Japantown, The Gyoza that came with my dish was really good. They forgot my Gyoza twice but that's ok, it was good. The price was a bit high for hat I got.
author: Bruce W.

description:
This was the first open  sushi restaurant i found in the neighborhood.  it was practically empty, but returning from an ultimate spa experience I was at peace with anything.   I ordered the garlic chicken and a spicy hamachi roll and miso soup.  I judge my sushi places on the hamachi and I was less than thrilled. It was just a little boring and the rolls were sloppily made (my Japanese/Korean friend tells me that sloppy rolls are an indication of a bad sushi chef).  The miso was too salty and my chicken was not too fresh tasting....could've been pre-made. 

My overall experience was just fine, but not a place I would go again if I had a choice of a different place to choose from, except if the other place was....see next review....
author: Aristocles P.

description:
My first dining at Sanppo I had the bento box for dinner. 
It wasn't as good as I thought it would be.
One of my Korean co worker kept mentioning that it is one of her favorite late night Japanese place... 
With a big question mark, I went in to get some rolls this time. 
It was actually very good! 
I think all the food here are Americanized Japanese food. Just keep that in mind and go eat, its not too bad at all for the price.
Their donburi are tasty also.
The restaurant is served by mostly cute and friendly Korean or Mongolian servers. Consistent service.
 I think there are couple of Japanese chefs in the kitchen also...
author: Mai K.

description:
Good food and cheap.  

Their lunch bento boxes are a great bargain.  For under $8, I can have 4 pieces of California roll, a salmon skin hand roll, a good portion of tonkatsu, miso soup, rice, and a salad.  

My poetry teacher took me here, and I am so grateful she introduced me to this place...
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I want the wasabi nasal burn.

I expect the wasabi nasal burn when it's slathered on my sushi roll.

It didn't deliver.  There was no heat.  No burn, no post nasal drip.

My sushi roll was just meh, eh, and ultimately 'nah'.

I wish I was at the table next to me, with the elderly Japanese ladies who obviously knew the owners, had not-on-the-menu items, and an endless flow of sake.  

I bet they had the burn.
author: Jenn A.

description:
Service was amazing and food was great.
Would recommend the Dragon Roll, Yakisoba, and Beef Curry.
Salad dressing's pretty good.
REALLY surprised this restaurant's rated lower than 4 stars. 
And 3 stars for stupid reasons? Come on.
author: Isaac N.

description:
When I'm craving for some Udon, Japanese beer & it's late.
This is the place.

Service is great, the Udon always hit the spot.
Price is affordable too.

Mon- Thurs - 11:30 AM - Midnight
Fri & Sat - 11:30 AM - 1 AM
Sunday - Noon - 10 PM
author: jubi l.

description: Have been here a handful of times, and I don't have one complaint. The service is always great, my glass of water was never low. They are super friendly and also have pretty decent prices. Their specials are big and affordable too. Didn't give it 5 stars because I think they could do a little more with the inside.
