Last time I was there I swore it smelt like cat urine, but it also could have been one of the other guests in the restaurant. All together though, this is my go-to sushi spot when I'm in the area!
author: Ashley M.

description:
decided to go get sushi in japan town with a friend. saw this restaurant on post street and thought it would be good so we checked it out. there were quite a few restaurants around and hoped that this would be good. we checked yelp before we went in and it had 3 stars compared to this other japanese restaurant next to it that had 2 1/2 stars, so we ended up going in.

the sushi was not bad, it was decent. i think that would be the only reason why i have a one star on this or else i wouldn't even give this restaurant any stars.

terrible service, they probably checked on us once and that was it, and whats sad is that it is not even a big restaurant.. the front side of the restaurant was closed and the back part only had like maybe 5 or 6 tables. 

we ordered the yakisoba, pan fried noodles. the presentation looked like it was just thrown on a plate, i could do it myself. the whole plate looked and tasted like something i could do in my own kitchen. it was priced as 9.50$ i think? and we got charged an extra dollar, we didn't complain, since we're not going back anymore.

bento box was small, but i assumed i was going to be like that knowing the price wasn't expensive. only thing that sucked is that the gyoza tasted so bad, it would probably be the worst gyoza i have ever had, i might even like the ones they serve in food courts. the beef teriyaki was black since they burned it, also terrible.

overall, never going back.
author: Mark M.

description:
my bf and i ordered the udon. What is includes: 4pieces of small meat, half an egg, 3pieces of fish cake, good amount of udon, and plain soup. 

it was equivalent to making cup noodles. 
total: $22 plus tip.
author: Amy T.

description:
This definitely stands as one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. The food is always very fresh and high quality, and the service is very nice and friendly. And the price is very reasonable.

My girfriend and I eat here pretty frequently, as it's one of the few restaurants we feel we can depend on. Usually we get tempura and some hamachi shashimi in a combo platter that includes miso soup and this salad with seseme seed dressing. Occasionally we also get ikura. All of it is good, and usually we can fill our tummies for under $40, including tip.
author: Robert G.

description:
RE: Possible fraud with charges. I thought the same thing had happened to me this week, but in looking at my bank statements, it looks like it wasn't a double charge. Instead, it seems they just waited about three months to actually send the charge through to my bank! Weird and annoying, but don't think that's technically illegal. 

As for the food, I quite like their ton katsu, and have no complaints about their sushi. Not the best, but not too bad.
author: Rain j.

description: This is the worse sushi I have had in the city. You would think that it would be good because it is located in the heart of Japan Town. We were sadly mistaken. Upon sitting down, the menu didn't look too appetizing. I ordered a simple shrimp tempura roll and even then they seemed to fail miserably. My roll was broken and they tried to piece it back together! I have never seen that happen. Ever! If you are ever in SF or in Japan Town please save your taste buds and avoid this place.
author: Ross D.

description:
I've never had the sushi here because I have favorite sushi places. They offer the best deal in J town for lunch, the Bento box is $6 I think for your choice of 3 items, soup and salad. The teriyaki is really good but the gyoza could be more flavorful.
Really efficient and friendly ladies work the restaurant.
author: Colleen B.

description: We had the bento boxes for lunch. The tea was delicious, the service was wonderful, and that is some of the best salmon I have ever had.
author: Jess P.

description: The food is good, that's what you need to know. The sushi and nigiri items are fresh every time I go there. It's not extravagant but good stuff when you are hungry and want a relatively fast served meal with a good price and the best part is it's open way late. Sometimes nothing else is open around jtown and when you need fuel right now in that area, it's the best choice because it's open, fast, friendly, and rarely too crowded.
author: Miguel L.

description: Went here for lunch! I thought it was a really decent place! They sit you quickly. The wait for the actual food was pretty quick! It tasted like authentic Japanese food. On the other hand, I dont know what it actually tastes like! The bento box tasted amazing! I fell in love with Japanese food!
author: Justin M.

description: Lunch bento box is definitely a great deal - the only place where you get three 'meat' choices and it's a solid sushi option. It's by no means great but you'll be full for under $10 bucks. After lunch, it's not really a great deal as you don't get much more food for a much higher cost so until its after hours, then check back in but after 2 PM - go almost anywhere in Jpantown (well, not tanpopo) but if you want a great deal on non sushi, great place for lunch. I think the cheap bento box is unavailable on weekends or sunday ... As noted, service is very attentive.
author: Joe B.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in the Japan Canter area. 
The food is always consistently good and fresh and the prices are reasonable (though my review is based on their vegetarian fare). It has the best vegetarian udon in the area ( and is one of the only places that offers veggie broth). Their tempura is great and their avocado rolls are filled with nice, big pieces of avocado. I have gone to Sanppo at least four times and never been disappointed.
author: Clare G.

description:
Patrons beware of the check when it arrives.  Lunch time with a party of 4 of us and decided to give this business a chance.  Ordered sake, a couple of rolls and four udon noodles.  There are plenty of other restaurants in japantown that will give you a better order of curry udon noodles for less than the 12.95, but nevertheless, that was what was ordered.   When the bill comes, as with a lot of typical Asians with close friends, we fight to grab the check.  Without bothering to look at the itemized bill, we pay with a credit card on the bottom number.  It seemed a bit pricey, but we add the tip in on top of the balance.  The waitress takes the charge slip and bill away and does not leave a copy with us.  Did not think anything of it and sat around for a few more minutes before leaving.  As we get ready to leave,  I requested a copy of the credit card receipt and check for my records and leave.  After getting a moment to finally look at the receipt, it turns out that the waitress added in a gratuity amount of 18% to our bill without saying anything about it.  It turns out that on top of the tip already included, she knew that I had put an additional amount of 18% and took the receipt away with the full knowledge of being tipped twice.   What kind of scam are they running?  

With this type of conduct in a tight economy, they would risk losing customers on marginal food?


There are many excellent restaurants in this area that have far better food and practices.
author: Peter L.

description: Now I know why there wasn't a huge line out the door during the Cherry Blossom festival.  First of all, I was really annoyed that they wouldn't let us get a window seat because that table was designed for 4 people, and then minutes after they seated another couple there (as well as the 4 top next to it).  The food was inexpensive, yes, but the quality was less than average.  The only thing decent in my bento was the small cut of salmon teriyaki, the katsu and salmon skin handroll were not great.  Also the service was really slow for this type of place.
author: Joshua S.

description: I ate Beef Udon at this place.  The beef was good, the broth was OK, the noodles were pretty good too.  Overall the atmosphere has no thrills and I guess its OK if you are just trying to pop in and have some soup.  It looks like being in the middle of Japantown these guys can do just a bit better.
author: Mike B.

description:
I don't get all the negative reviews on here, this place is a great place to go for a quick sushi night with friends.  I really like their miso and bento boxes, decent price for salad, rice, miso and three choices (I usually go with the kappa and california rolls and either teriyaki chicken or gyoza).

All these pretentious wanna be critics are wearing down the rating for this place.  Take it for what it is.  :D
author: Jenn F.

description:
God don't go here unless all you want is microwaved teriyaki.  My buddy and I had the sashimi moriawase and 2 rolls ... god awful.  The only thing that was good was the Asahi.  The hamachi tasted like a rubber eraser.  Be weary ... don't listen to the 4 star reviews because they're coming from people that would go to Benihana.

Try a real restaurant like Koo or Sebo.
author: James F.

description:
Totally decent sushi place in Japantown. We came here spontaneously with a bigger group and they got us a table immediately. Service is friendly and the sushi is good. I have become a little picky, since we go to Wayo Sushi about once a week and their fish is extraordinary but Sanppo works.
We had a few Germans in town who wanted sushi and everyone liked it.
author: Alexandra D.

description: I haven't been here in a while, really dissapointed in the overall experience.  Order 4 dinners and a sushi roll, 2 of the dinners came out first and waited close to 10 minutes for the other 2 dinner, then the sushi rolls came out.  Ask for extra ginger, didn't get it. Teriyaki chicken was only so so, on the dry side, beef was much better.  Service was below standard in my opinion, only two waitress, always looking for refill of tea or water for the boys, definitely need a third.
author: Milton L.

description:
This place is ok. A little pricey, but less expensive than other places in the hood. 

I wanted a simple teriyaki dinner, no fish. The chicken was ok, tempura was decent. The folks working were very nice and it was speedy, and they gave me tea while I waited. 

I'll probably go there again at some point, but it's not a priority.
author: Annie F.

description:
It seems odd to me, as a visitor to San Francisco, that you can't get the best Japanese food in Japan town.  I wouldn't classify this as the best.  But, it was perfectly good.  We went here with a group and they took very good care of us.  Put a bunch of tables together in a back almost separate room out of the way and service was fine, if a bit disorganized. But we were a big group (15 people), and it's difficult to serve that many all at once.

Prices were great, and everyone left satisfied that they got a good meal for the money.
author: Marc R.

description:
I always pass by and wanted to try it, and actually did it today.  I was craving a bento box and they have it for $7.50.

The pros - the staff was friendly, the food was cheap.  The California rolls were pretty good.  They came over with some delicious rice tea before we even had to ask.  

The cons - the gyoza we ordered had a lot of ginger for my taste, I had to spit it out immediately.  The waitress took away our vinegar before we were done with it.  The pork katsu was FRIED - like deep fried.  Basically the food could have been better.
author: Carrey W.

description: Food was OK but the service was pretty rushed to the point of being rude (apparently they are in a big hurry to get out at closing time).
author: Sam J.

description: I really like this place. I go with my family of 3, they always remember us, including my 4-year old. The menu has some delicious choices of sushi, their miso soup sets apart from other sushi places I go. Yes, it's a bit more expensive than usual, but it's worth it...
author: Juliana G.

description:
My JP Friend, wanted to check out the famous JP Town and we had the chance to check out this great JP restaurant out! 

What a Nice Place to dine! 

In the JP Town, you have to serve authentic JP food in order for you to survive as a JP restaurant! and you know what? We had a great JP family of three generations sat right next to us, and another lovely JP couple sat on the left of us! they all love the food and so was my JP friend!  

What does that tell you? Great food, good price, friendly services and you can really snatch JP flavor when you ever come visit! 

JP Restaurant, approved by nice JP people! Do I need to say more?!
author: Andrew W.

description: My favorite sushi place in SF, or anywhere for that matter.  Waaay better than Zushi puzzle that's considered best sushi in SF.  Super cozy place, friendly service, yummy sushi.  I've been coming here with my parents for years!
author: Lucy S.

description:
Beware of automatic 18 % gratuity added without comment even for 2 people!

Food was uninspired, dry nigiri and chewy meat and relatively pricey.

Wouldn't come back.
author: Rene R.

description:
Went here for lunch with the family and I was pretty surprised by the results. The food was pretty okay, I definitely have had better Japanese in the Westfield Mall. The amount of food that they give you was a lot. That was pretty surprising. I got the Tempura Combo 3 and there was a shit load of tempura,to the point where I just couldn't eat all of it. And that is saying a lot b/c Im fat and I love tempura. The sushi was alright and everything about this place was pretty mediocre. Nothing too outstanding. 

The service was kind of blah and the two women serving us seemed to be fighting...awkward. And they didn't really know whose food was whose.
author: Dustin H.

description:
Ok. Hits & misses. I came here years ago with friends who used to frequent this place for typical Japanese food. My meals then were good, but not off the charts. I made a mental note to go back, but was steered away after a friend had a run-in with a rude server.

I gave Sanppo another chance last weekend, and had some nice sushi. Some of it was totally blah, which I'll never order again: 
salmon skin roll (soggy salmon skin and not much of it)
uni nigiri (they told me it was fresh, but there was a slight "offness" to it)

I will however come back for the tuna and sake sushi. It was absolutely delicious. I even ordered a Miss Vivian (I think that's the name) roll with shrimp tempura, tobiko, with nice slices of white tuna on top. Fantastic! I should've kept my order to this roll, the tuna & sake nigiri, and maybe one other raw fish sushi. The pieces were fresh, nice sized and delicious.

Another tiny drawback, but not too big of a deal, was our server forgot the edamame we ordered, but it showed up on the bill. We pointed out the mistake, and they were apologetic. It happens.. no biggie. I usually don't hit Japantown for sushi, but will come back to Sanppo if the mood strikes while in this neighborhood. It's worth a try.
author: Antoi C.

description:
The food - decent and prices are a little cheaper than the restaurants across the street in Kinokunya Building so we thought we would save some money and go here.

Not bad. I had the Pork Roast Ramen. Not bad.

My friends had the sukiyaki udon (she loved it but she never gets to eat Japanese food so her opinion is taken..lightly, I think she loved it more because her udon was served in one of those kettle/pots), her husband had the katsu curry and he loved it too but...

My boyfriend had Chirashi Sushi and he didn't even finish it. The rice was a little too sweet and sticky...just not exactly right and the fish was okay.

Nothing spectacular here but a little cheaper than the restaurants across the street.
author: Wendy B.

description:
For the Japantown area, prices aren't too bad. Service is good. Rolls are decent. More like 3.5 stars.

I've been coming here for years and it's always been consistently decent. It's not the blow me away, jaw dropping, Japanese food like other places I've been to but it has also never did me wrong.

For the past year or so I noticed they added these specialty hybrid rolls. Many of which, if you're already familiar with, you're probably eaten versions of them. They're about $10 each and they are a good size portion.

The prices are ok considering that Japantown is a SF Tourist attraction.  If you eat inside the main mall, you'll be paying almost double the price of other typical Japanese Restaurants.

I know if I have a craving for some decent Japanese food in Japantown I'll most likely come here as my first choice.
author: Bert T.

description:
I've seen this restaurant whenever i went up to SF and finally i got to try it.  The service was great, and their sushi was fresh.  I even had their curry udon and it was sooooo good!!

Definitely go here if you have the chance!
author: Jaimee S.

description: The restaurant is great! They have good service and nice prices for a sushi restaurant. But the food is definitely the best part, I recommend the Dragon Roll and the K-Pop roll which tastes amazing. I love to go and eat sushi at this restaurant, and I go there a lot. The miso soup is a good appetizer. I recommend Sanppo to everyone.
author: Justin L.

description:
***3.5 Starts***
I've been there a few times now and had consistently good sushi each time. Yes, they're not fabulous, but for the price and location I will keep going back. They ARE open for lunch. My favorites are the New York roll (4.95), Avocado Maki (3.25), Kappa Maki (2.95), Seaweed salad (3.95) and of course love the Edamame (3.00).
author: Erin S.

description: Quaint little corner sushi shop in Japantown. Had the #18 Inari (Sweet Fried Tofu) and the #19 Tamago (Egg), both from the Nigiri Sushi menu. I was so hungry and the Tamago looked so delectable I forgot to take a photo but I did take a photo of the Inari. Good stuff. Both very succulent. The two women who were waiting on every one were sweet and very nice. My friend also had the San Francisco Roll, I think it was, with ebi (shrimp), eel, fish eggs and avocado. She said it was very filling. I'd recommend it.
author: Lauren L.

description:
Took me a while to remember which sushi place I actually ate at, after awhile all the joints blend in. I ended up choosing this one based on my 'California Roll Rule'

California Roll Rule - Whoever has the cheapest CA roll should be the least pretentious and is worth a shot. 

And well Sanppo was fine. I'm definitely not going to go out of my way to hit this place up but if you're around, go ahead hop in, its not going to hurt you.
author: Oz B.

description:
I went to this place for the first time during the Cherry Blossom festival, so I expected it to be busy. Even with that there were quite a few things that I consider unacceptable. 

1. In Japan tipping is considered kinda rude as it is double payment. This is a Japanese restaurant  in the middle of a huge Japanese community. Yet when I received my bill there was already an added gratuity built into the bill. I could understand this for a large party, but my check was for two. Personally I think tipping should be for a job well done, and I don't think anyone has the right to add twenty percent to my bill without at the very least informing me before I order. 

2. When I was seated I waited 5-10 min before I had to ask someone to bring me a menu. Then again to bring my check, which was wrong the first time. What's worse is after all that waiting they practically stood over our table waiting for us to leave once we had the check. (At this point there wasn't even a line.)

3. On a hot day, I got a very small glass of water, no ice, and it was only refilled once. 

4. My food was decent even if the pork was a little over done, but my husband couldn't even finish his it was so bad. 

5. The place was decorated in a Japanese style, but the TV was tuned to a Spanish station watching wrestling.
author: J L.

description: Went here today with my friend. We ordered California Rolls, Philidelphia Rolls, Salmon with skin Rolls, and Tofu soup. The Philidelphia rolls were really good; basically it's sourcream and salmon. California rolls were good too. Salmon with skins wasn't as good. The Tofu soup was good and filling. The service was ok. There is no seating, so you go and sit on any table. You are served right away and they brought us the food in decent time. They didn't check up on us and we acutally had to signal to the waitress to give us the check, who was sitting around (since there were only 4 people there). The prices are decent. This is the only place around Japantown where you would find $3.95/$4.00ish sushi. I would just suggest to go around 3/4ish.
author: Alina R.

description:
My cousin introduced me here to get some sashimi party platters. Not too bad for $50. There was a decent amount of sashimi.

I came here for dinner with my man and the food was "okay". There wasn't anything to celebrate over.  

Overall, I might come back here for the sashimi platters, but not the bento boxes =P.
author: A L.

description:
FRAUD WARNING!!

 Holly S*#@t!!

I just have a exactly same experience as Aiko. R this morning!!

Last time I ate there was  2 months ago with my buddy, and they charged the exact same amount as last time yesterday.

Gee.

I called my bank.
author: Mike N.

description:
After trying a couple really disappointing sushi restaurants in the area, my friend and I decided to try Sanppo. To our surprise the food was delicious. 

That friend is now a boyfriend and we have made Sanppo a habit. We eat there at least once every other week. The staff is always friendly and happy to see us, and even calls to offer reservations on weekends when they know they'll be busy. The food is always hot and fresh, and the sushi is divine! It's not the best in the city but it's delicious and well worth the price. Even my parents (who aren't fans of Japanese food) loved the atmosphere and food they had.

I would recommend everything on the menu, since there isn't a single thing that I have ordered that isn't amazing. The price can be a little high, but it's well worth the experience you'll have.
author: M. C.

description: I ordered the chicken teriyaki and grilled salmon roll bento box for dinner and shared a spicy tuna roll. The chicken was okay. Nothing special. The true disappointment was the sushi rolls. I don't know how they cook their rice, but it was hard, dry and chewy. The fish wasn't fresh. The salad had a ranch dressing on it which was odd to me. I'm used to seeing ginger dressings. I liked their roasted barley tea and seaweed salad, but that's not saying much. Overall, I thought the service was quick, but the quality of the sushi left me dissatisfied.
author: Katherine N.

description: Had water, Edamame, 2pc. Tako Nigiri, and 2pc. Hamachi Nigiri. The place has got a little bit of a "Japanese" feel to it, with solid wood furnishings, neutral green paint, and the ceiling light area made to look like a type of paper screen. My other friends ordered bento boxes which arrived 2 minutes after my Edamame (which was still steaming) appetizer arrived. Edamame was well salted with course salt; however, the gyoza was too spicy and the tako was a bit rubbery. The hamachi was tender with a slightly sweet aftertaste. We got rushed out of the place, but we did arrive 5 minutes before closing time. Still, this leaves some gray area as to how I should rate this place so I'll be nice and put 3 stars... :S
author: Nathaniel O.

description: And they have late night ramen. Not great. But not bad either.
author: Kevo M.

description: Decent sushi, the rolls were huge and the prices reasonable but the service was SLOW. They didn't refill my drink the entire time I was there. But if you want some decent, cheap sushi in Japantown with good hours here's your place.
author: Chris L.

description: The portions are huge! However, the food is only decent and the service is...missing? I can't even remember how many times I made eye contact with the server just to have her look back to me and walk away. I practically had to jump up and down on the table to get her to come over for the check. If you're hungry and want a lot of food at a good price, check this place out. But if you can't stand bad service and are a snob about the quality of the food, I would not recommend Sanppo.
author: Lizzy C.

description: I like this place a lot. Any friends I have visiting from out of town, I take them here. A couple coworkers want to meet up for a bite to eat, Sanppo. It used to be my suggestion now they all want to go to Sanppo. Good size portions. They don't get 5 stars because they aren't too well equipped to handle a lot of people, so when it's busy, their service suffers. But good food, good prices and an enviable location make this place a must.
author: Klik W.

description: Had lunch today since Isobune let me down last time I went. The service was extremely friendly and the sushi was great. Had the lunch sushi special which included a spicy tuna roll and 5 nigiri pieces for only 10 dollars (of course, this included salad and miso soup). I also ordered the rainbow roll...to die for!! Left completely satisfied with the service, the food and the price.
author: Crf C.

description: More of a 3.5 stars.  I was a little nervous coming here for dinner (it looked pretty touristy) but I was pleasantly surprised.  Large portions, yummy rolls (although most of the rolls we had were cooked, not raw), friendly service and not a lot of money.  I will reserve judgment on the quality of the fish since we didn't have any sashimi.
author: Mitzi C.

description: Yes this place might be a little cheaper than its peers in the Japantown area but you definitely lose out on the quality. The sushi rolls are noticeably poorer than usual and the deep fried one I got was soggy and not crunchy at all. The bento box was decent, portions were good. This place is cheaper but still is not "cheap" per se or I would bump a star for value points.
author: Ed L.

description: You get what you pay for... The miso soup was way too salty, the donburi was like something I would make (and I can't cook!), and the teriyaki chicken tasted like... burnt... chicken and nothing else.  Staff was friendly enough, but unfortunately I'll be avoiding this place in the future.
author: Jimmy V.

description:
I went there with James F, http://www.yelp.com/biz/wAPk6QJV6NtXxNQgSd1dkA#hrid:Iu9m13cy9h-8wCTmXm1bCg

His review is a bit harsh but basically on point. Super average place where the rolls are pretty safe, though not even really good. I have a hard time believing it can get more than 2 stars

Price was normal

Best
- beer + hot sake

Ok
- rolls (tried lion king and a forgettable roll)

No
- sashimi
author: xo x.

description: The BEST sushi in the city. Prices are fantastic! I always have the same waitresses which show that there's a low turn over in that family owned restaurant. The sushi is ALWAYS fresh, i have NEVER had a bad experience there. Best place!
author: Mea D.

description:
I really love this place.  I agree with others who have said it's not "over-the-moon" quality sushi, but it's quite fresh, the price is right, and I adore the servers - they're friendly and funny and very good at making you feel at home and cared for. In fact, that may be the biggest selling point - it's downright cozy there.
They serve a very yummy gen mai cha tea, no extra charge, that I can't get enough of; I really love their miso soup; we always order the hamachi, and it's always fresh and delicious, as is the crispy hot tempura. We've never been disappointed when my boyfriend and I come here.
I guess maybe it *is* American-style Japanese but it's clean and cozy and reasonable - oh, and it's one of the only restaurants open after 10pm you can eat at without feeling greasy and stuffed afterwards!  I think this may be my favorite S. F. restaurant... :O (I've only been here about 20 months tho' - give me some time!)
author: Marianne S.

description: This is the only place that I really ever want to get sushi. My fiance and I come here ALL THE TIME. Like at least once a week almost. We know everyone there. They are all sweet people. We've been eating here for over 4 years non stop. Never had any problems with food, or with the bill. It's like visiting family every time we go there. They are open very late and the girls work very hard, please tip well... they have to work almost every day of the year.... even xmas and new years. We just lost our favorite chef though... Tomi-son!!!!! We miss you...
author: Serina H.

description: Mediocre sushi in J-Town.  Prices are also mediocre.  You get what you pay for here.  Dont have much to say here.
author: Charles C.

description: We came here for my boyfriend's birthday and he wanted to watch the game, but their big TV didn't work. The food and service was OK. I didn't feel like it was very authentic even though it was in the middle of J-town. The other restaurants in the area were definitely a lot more crowded. I don't highly recommend it, but it wasn't all bad.
author: Gladys C.

description: This place could be alot better if it wanted to but its in J-town and so it is alway going to get good business.  They have a great steak shouyu if one know their menu very well.  They have decent salmon sashimi nothing special.  The udon and zoba is halfway decent too.  They do have good katsu curry though.
author: Stevezee C.

description: Wasn't really that bad but they didn't have chicken katsu, which is what I wanted to order.
author: Justin R.

description: Since I'm in the neighborhood (unfortunately) for bar review classes, my friend and I come here for lunch a lot.  The food may not be mind-blowing, but it's always been pretty good.  To be fair, though, I don't eat sushi (I know. I'm a cretin.) and so I can't really say how it is.  The big pluses are:  It's cheap! They know we only have about 45 minutes so they always serve us super fast, and the waitress never fails to remember that my friend is a vegetarian.  Also, I've learned to eat noodles with chopsticks.
author: Susan S.

description: Went here on 12/21 for a late night dinner - originally wanted to go to tampopo or honu but both places were closed. It was b/t this place or Denny''s - I wish we went to Denny's. I had the ramen - it was poor. Even though I was starving and drunk, I could not  bring myself to finish the bowl - as it was a huge waste of calories.  The ramen tasted like instant ramen - infact it probably was instant ramen. My friend got a dinner box with chicken, tonkatsu and gyoza - in short - not good. Perhaps the sushi is better - but don't go here for ramen or bento box items.
author: Joe M.

description: While Sanppo isn't the best or the cheapest, it's always been consistent and friendly.  Most importantly, they are open until 2am on weekends, which means that an after-midnight sushi craving is easily conquered without having to poison oneself with stale Safeway """"sushi"""".
author: Frankie D.

description: The sushi is fresh, the ramen is tasty, the gyoza is enjoyable, overall, a very satisfying sushi trip.  Its a great option for cheap, simple sushi that isn't going to blow you mind but isn't going to disappoint either.
author: Mike G.

description: I haven't ate at too many Japanese restaurants in the SF area but this place left a good impression on me. The sushi was fresh and the service was good that day.
author: James C.

description: After food window shopping in the mall at Japantown, my friends and I wanted to find a cheap place to eat. We came here because it had ramen for one friend and variety selection for me and my other friend. We ended up getting Ten-Don which was really good because I love tempura. My friend was disappointed with the ramen, so I have to go on her review of the food too. The prices were resonable and the food was decent, so three-stars for letting me leave satisfied.
author: Jamie L.

description:
i love this place..

if u can get over the hilarity that it's a japanese restaurant owned by koreans.. its an awesome place...
ive had almost all of the specialty sushi rolls.. and LOVE them all
especially the lion king roll.. baked salmon.. oh my gosh.. im drooling just thinking about it...

and.. i always get great fantastic service.. even though i always order to-go.. they always toss in something extra.. like a HUGE portion of miso soup.. or an extra roll (mind you i order 60-80 dollars worth of sushi)
and as i wait for my order.. i sip on some tea and miso soup pleasantly chatting with the waitresses or the owner..
author: monica c.

description: Despite the non-Japanese staff, I'll have to say that the food here is quite quite good. Although I definitely have had better sushi, this restaurant is the place to go for relatively cheap food and quick service. The waiters/waitresses might be slow at times but the place can grow on you. It's a place that I wouldn't mind going again, or even bringing a group of friends.
author: Derek Y.

description: My boyfriend and I ate here late one night when most restaurants in Japantown were closed. I had a bento box and my boyfriend had the udon. The food was fairly average, the gyoza was raggedy and looked like it was falling apart. The udon was flavored a little too sweetly. We also ordered some sushi but it wasn't memorable, unfortunately. I think this place is good for late night junk food runs (tempura and gyoza) but I wouldn't come here for really good sushi or bento boxes.
author: Katherine P.

description: Not bad, the food was filling. The price was decent, about $10 per person. There's not much parking, but there's also no line up usually. I had the katsu donburi and was satisfied. I also split a spicy tuna roll. It was just enough spicy.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Place was very, very decent for the price...esp for SF sushi. Soba was not bad, I liked the fried tofu...however, rolls were just ok. Have not experienced the fraudulant charges that everyone keeps mentioning, but will definitely keep a look-out.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Came here after an event and was just trying our luck for a late night sushi hit and was suprised to find this place being open and they are open till 1am on weekends! We had the salmon sushi roll which was decent but the fish had some tendons in between and a bowl of sukiyaki with beef slices, tofu and vege. The broth tasted ok but the beef slices were too thick and chewy, not the sukiyaki that I'm used to. Oh well, decent place for a late night sushi snack and it was pretty full at 11pm! I saw other diners ordering the bento box which seemed like a good deal.
author: Yan M.

description: Tired of the 'tradition' of going to Isobune with my fiancee whenever I'm in the area, I opted for something cheap with variety and doesn't taste like it has been sitting on a boat for a few trips around the bar.  Looking across Peace Plaza, there it was.  "Hey, let's go check it out."  So we did.  Surprisingly, it was one of the few restaurants still open given how late it was.  The waitress was friendly and accommodating.  Given my expectations that ordering sushi from Sanppo was meant to be of the 'fast food' variety, I wasn't let down in the slightest bit.  The sushi and rolls tasted fresh and it was filling for the price.  Looks like I have found myself a new place to get a quick sushi fix if I happen to be back in town and it's late enough.
author: JP A.

description: Tried it twice, both times I had a stomach ache, which lingered till the next day.  The fish is bad!:(  They don't know how to handle the fish. The good thing about this place, is the late hours, and that's the only reason why I went there.  Next time, I know of some other places open that late.   Everyone on that street closes early.  Nevertheless, sayunara!!!
author: Demanding T.

description: ew.  i know better for sushi, but hey it was past 10pm and you know how it goes.  slim pickins.  surprise surprise, the uni was excellent, some of the freshest ive had.  but the soft shell crab (too heavily battered and underseasoned) and ikura (very sticky and on its last legs) was gross.  blech.
author: Kimby T.

description: Love this place. Maybe it's because I'm a regular here, maybe it's because the wait staff knows me...who knows. It's always delicious, the fish is always fresh, and they always tend to bring me something extra in addition to what I order.  I admit, the dinner boxes are not the best, but this is a sushi joint, not some teriyaki take out place. If you want teriyaki, go somewhere else....but I always enjoy it, and never leave disappointed.
author: Scott R.

description: I come here practically once every week.  I  always order the beef udon.  I have yet to find a place that had beef udon taste this good for the price.  The "31 special special" roll is also great.
author: David O.

description: I think I may have found the best roll in the universe here.  There are certain things that I like to order when I get sushi (I am an unimaginative, scared white girl, go ahead and judge) - spicy tuna, maguro, hamachi, and a few others.  These are favorites though.  Sanppo has a spicy tuna roll WITH MAGURO AND HAMACHI ON TOP.  It's like a roll of all of my favorite things!  I mean, almost; I had to get kappa maki too, but for $14, I had two rolls which usually require me ordering four things.  I was so excited, I proceeded to rush home with my sushi for an impromptu sake fueled underwear dance party.  I was out of sake, but I was totally wearing underwear, so it was still a win.  This roll is my new quick and easy J-town go to; especially since the staff was super nice and sat me down and gave me tea while I waited.  They're even nicer if you're a fussy toddler; then you get little origami flowers to play with.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Surprisingly, not a lot of good J-town sushi. I've been to Sanppo several times now, and haven't been disappointed, but also haven't been wowed. For a group of businesses labeled JAPANTOWN, I would expect more. Had a Giant Roll which was... wait for it... giant. It was tasty, with avocado, tobiko, soft shell crab and unagi. I like big rolls with a lot of stuff in them; I just don't like the price that is usually attached. 
I also had a combination donburi rice plate with tempura and beef teriyaki. This was actually quite good. The beef was tender and cooked with peppers and onions. The tempura was over-battered, but still plentiful for the price.
author: Ben C.

description: I came here again the day after I wrote the last review to try more of their stuff . The dragon roll was not all that great . I didn't like the ramen either . And apparantly , there was a fly inside the soy sauce . Yuck ! Sorry sanppo , you're lowered down to 3 stars .
author: Eileen L.

description: I thought Sanppo was acceptable, but not great.  We ordered the bento box, ramen, chirashi (raw tuna over rice).  I thought the chirashi was just average, but my friends liked the bento and the ramen soup. They have several different rolls which run about $9.95 which I should of tried. I anything, some of them look very interesting. The "caterpillar" roll is green and has little eyes like a real caterpillar.  The waitress said this restaurant has been here 25 years, but has changed owners four times.  Not sure how long the current owner has been here.
author: Eric G.

description: The food isn't that special, but waiters are always very nice. Me and my friends come here a lot because this is our safe sushi spot before Karaoke. The only thing that wasn't that great was the rice bowl with egg? You really can go wrong with rice and egg. The sauce was really bland but the sushi, tempura and noodles are very good.
author: Shirley D.

description: Outstanding UDON! Broth was very flavorful, slow cooker real. KITCHEN was spotless, service excellent. Green tea as soon as you sit down, cup kept full all event. Fully brewed, gracefully served. Going back for more UDON tomorrow.
author: ce c.

description: Standard-quality sushi, but some rolls are very cheap. Overall a good sushi place!  3 vegetarian rolls:  Tamago, Inari, Avocado.  Would have liked something a little more unique, but that's hard to come by with vegetarian sushi.  My fiance eats meat, and he thought it was pretty good as well.
author: Rachael S.

description: So, I've noticed the mixed reviews for this place and I guess I can sympathize with some to a certain extent. However, ultimately, I really really like this place. Perhaps it's because I've been such a frequent patron in the past that I get free wakame salad (which is really good here...the perfect amount of seasame oil balances the interesting texture of the seaweed). Or that the servers are ALWAYS nice (but that depends on how you treat them). Or maybe it's because no matter what I get, it's all pretty damn good. The caterpillar roll is good and quite reasonable. So is the 49er roll. Their sashimi and nigiri showcase their fish quality. At lunch, you can get their sushi special for about $14, which includes a roll and then 5-6 pieces of nigiri. The kitsune udon is very good, as well. They're open pretty late....later than almost everything at the Japan Center (which I don't find particularly fantastic and more expensive, too). I've been here many, many times before and I will continue to. Why? Because the price is good, so is the sushi, and I am consistently happy when I leave.
author: Veronica W.

description: oh crap. i just read the other reviews about fraud and now i'm all worried and stuff. so, if i was there this past sunday, i won't see the charges until december(?) the food was nothing to write home about but it suited us just fine for that moment.
author: Xelyn x.

description: This place is horrible. We got Gaijin service, meaning white person who gets snubbed. No complementary tea. The worst reconstituted miso soup. It was so salty I had to keep putting hot water into it to salvage it. The pork tonkatsu was greasy, gray, which meant recooked in not hot enough oil. When I complained, he said there was nothing he could do about it. NEVER GOING BACK. And it's not that cheap. Stick to Mifune or any other sushi place We Be on 16th. Always consistent.
author: yuri s.

description: This place serves pretty decent food. The hours are super convenient because most places in Japan Town close pretty early. I have gone there around even 11PM and they have been open which is really cool. The food isn't traditional Japanese food but it tastes really good.
author: Barn M.

description: I am a fan of Japanese food, have been in Japan, and even cook Japanese food at home.   Some 20 years ago, this place was one of my favorites.  The name of the restaurant used to be Tampopo back then.  I recently had a chance to have a lunch there again.  It was very disappointing.  I ordered a bowl of ramen and it was the worst ramen I ever had in my life.  When it comes to ramen, there are two things that are important: broth and noodle.  The texture of noodle was so so.  The broth was supposed to be boiled for a long time with mixture of meat and vegetables to add delicacies and rich flavor and then added flavor such as miso, soy sauce, or some other spices.  It didn't taste anything like that.  The broth was nothing but salty and dull miso taste.  I just don't know how to describe the taste otherwise.  The size of the meal was not big enough either.  I hate to say bad things about hard working people's work, but the ramen at this place was just unacceptable.  For $10 for lunch, there are many other decent places in Japan Town.
author: Chris M.

description: WORST RESTAURANT EVER! My boyfriend, a couple of friends, and myself went to the annual Wek'fest at Japan Town and we were pretty hungry from all the festivities. Being that it was freezing outside and we did not want to walk very far, we stumbled upon Sanppo...We went inside and were not even greeted. They sat us down and didn't even acknowledge our presence for about 10 minutes...A lady finally came over and asked, "ready?" We got our food (by the way, they didn't have a great selection) and were disgusted by the quality of the food. The rice was cold, and the tempura tasted a bit...yuck! The bill came faster than the actual food and we were surprised at how high the bill was...We left a 15% tip--which I think is pretty good esp when the food and service suck ..We were halfway back to the garage when one of the waitresses runs after us saying that she couldn't find our tip!--which was underneath the soy sauce... I think it was a bit rude to run after us and accuse us of lying saying that she looked everywhere when as a matter of it was less than 2 minutes than we had left...After she was done asking us for a tip because she couldn't find ours, I gave her $3 which was the only cash I had in my wallet and she rudely sad, "THAT'S IT?!" I was already pissed off and she told us never to come back! VERY RUDE..DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!! DO NOT SUPPORT RUDE PEOPLE WHO ASK FOR TIPS!!!!!!!!
author: Sarah R.

description: This place was so bad that the rice in my sushi roll was stale.. Don't bother eating here.
author: Virginia N.

description:
First of all, I don't know what "Sanppo" means. I don't think there is such a word in Japanese. 
Anyway. I went there with a group of friends. As soon as I walk into a sushi restaurant I can sense if something doesn't seem quite right. Then you place your order and the wait person doesn't understand the items you are ordering, or can't answer simple questions like "do you have pickled plum roll?" which is a basic item in any sushi place.
My sister ordered "tsukimi" udon. It is a udon noodle dish which has an egg on top, and the yolk looks like the moon. Thus the name "tsukimi" which means "moon watching". The food takes long time to come out...everybody else is almost done eating while my sister patiently waits for her noodle dish. It finally comes, and it has no egg on top. She tells the server the egg is missing. She answers that it does not come with it. My sister insists that there should be an egg on it. Then waitress goes back in the kitchen, and come back another 5 minutes later with the noodles with an egg on top. No apologies or anything.
My dish, which was grilled mackerel, was not very good. It is a tasty fish on its own, so I suspect they do not use quality fish. Then they overcooked it. 
This is a place to avoid, like so many other unauthentic Japanese restaurants.
author: M K.

description: To begin, the wait staff is rude and hard of hearing.  Upon entering the establishment, there were people waiting, so I went to the cashier area to ask how long the wait would be, but the waitress did not hear me, so I had to repeat the question four times before I got an answer.  During that time, she ask my name three times and I told her three times what it was, but she still did not answer the initial question, "how long is the wait for two people?"  After I got an answer, she walked away and I had to come back again to the stand to ask to have my name be put on the waiting list.  When we finally got a table, the table next to us cleared and another group came.  The table was set for three, but the party had four people, so they made the guy stand at the table for more than ten minutes before they finally got him a seat.  After the guy got his seat, we got our tea, ten to twenty minutes.  The appetizers came, however, we didn't get all of them.  Then the sushi came, but it was the wrong items.  We told the waitress that it was the wrong item, and she had the nerve to tell us that we ordered a spicy salmon roll instead of the spicy tuna.  I told her that she must have heard me wrong, but she said that was what I ordered.  We also told her that we were missing an appetizer, she looked at us blankly and said yes, it was coming.  It was another thirty minutes or so before we realized that one of the items ordered had not come out yet.  After twenty more minutes, we just wanted to get out of there and ask them to cancel the order.  They refused.  It was just an aweful experience overall.  Like everyone says, service is bad, the food is better at the mall, and definitely not coming back.
author: Ai D.

description: Not sure that sushi is their main specialty , since I noticed that they had nabe, hotpot, and sukiyaki dishes that most other restaurants in J-town don't carry, it might be that they specialize in hotpots. For appetizers, my cousin and I had the melt in your mouth, cold fresh tofu, which was served in a bowl of ice water accompanied by a bonito shavings in soy sauce dip.  We also had a huge bowl of spinach in sesame sauce and it was not overdressed but nicely tender with just a hint of sesame sauce, just the way I like it.  For entrees we split the Oyster Nabe which was chock full of plump juicy oysters and napa cabbage in a lovely clean broth with clear yam noodles and a plate of tuna and salmon sashimi.  The oyster nabe was a revelation, hearty and flavorful, without being heavy.  And the sashimi fish was pretty decent, not fishy, and very soft to mouth, although not exactly delicately cut.  With a nice, dry chilled sake, that tasted delicately and cleanly of melons, we had a very satisfying and healthy meal.
author: Tara W.
